lines.text: Yeah, they're full of great ideas.

lines.speaker: u2909
lines.text: I just stopped your heart for five seconds. It felt like an eternity, didn't it? Did you know that you can stop the human heart for up to ten minutes before the onset of brain damage?

lines.speaker: u2904
lines.text: No, I didn't know that.

lines.speaker: u2909
lines.text: We learn something new about ourselves every day.  Now. Maybe I didn't make myself clear. It is very important that you tell me exactly what Captain Picard knows.

lines.speaker: u2904
lines.text: I told you everything. You might as well just kill me right now.

lines.speaker: u2909
lines.text: Careful, Captain. That's a fifty gigawatt forcefield. I wouldn't want to see you get hurt.

lines.speaker: u2906
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u2907
lines.text: Worf, prepare a spread of photon torpedoes. We'll have to hit them the instant they begin to cloak.

lines.speaker: u2911
lines.text: Aye, sir.

lines.speaker: u2907
lines.text: We're only going to get one shot at this. Target their primary reactor. With any luck, their warp core should implode.

lines.speaker: u2912
lines.text: Transwarp at your command, Sir!

lines.speaker: u2927
lines.text: Execute!

lines.speaker: u2913
lines.text: What's going on? When do we get paid off...?

lines.speaker: u2931
lines.text: Soon, Captain... Quite soon.

lines.speaker: u2914
lines.text: Sir, the shields... Non- responsive.

lines.speaker: u2918
lines.text: Scotty...?

lines.speaker: u2915
lines.text: Sir... Something's jamming our transmission. An energy surge.

lines.speaker: u2917
lines.text: Locate.

lines.speaker: u2915
lines.text: Surge from astern, sir. Aft quarter!

lines.speaker: u2917
lines.text: On screen.

lines.speaker: u2916
lines.text: Whoever they are, they're getting closer.

lines.speaker: u2923
lines.text: I'll go...

lines.speaker: u2916
lines.text: No!... I'll do it.  Give me your phaser.

lines.speaker: u2923
lines.text: Captain, what's happening?!

lines.speaker: u2917
lines.text: We are under attack! Stand by for evasive -- stand by for --

lines.speaker: u2918
lines.text: What about Spock?

lines.speaker: u2924
lines.text: I am not sure. Only time will answer.  Kirk. I thank you. What you have done is --

lines.speaker: u2918
lines.text: What I have done, I had to do.

lines.speaker: u2924
lines.text: But at what cost? Your ship... Your son.

lines.speaker: u2918
lines.text: If I hadn't tried, the cost would have been my soul.

lines.speaker: u2921
lines.text: My Lord... what are your orders?

lines.speaker: u2919
lines.text: I underestimated him... He did the one thing I didn't anticipate ... He destroyed himself...

lines.speaker: u2921
lines.text: Sir, may I --

lines.speaker: u2919
lines.text: Killing his son was <U>stupid</U>! It made Kirk willing to die.

lines.speaker: u2921
lines.text: We still have the prisoners, sir. Perhaps their information --

lines.speaker: u2919
lines.text: They are useless! It was Kirk I needed. And I let him slip away.

lines.speaker: u2921
lines.text: But surely, our mission has not failed -- ?

lines.speaker: u2919
lines.text: Our mission is over. I have failed... A human has been bolder and more ruthless than I...  That -- is the real dishonor.

lines.speaker: u2920
lines.text: Commander, these are some of the most famous people in Starfleet! Admiral Kirk, my God!

lines.speaker: u2930
lines.text: Good for you, Lieutenant.

lines.speaker: u2920
lines.text: But it's damn irregular. No destination orders, no encoded i.d...

lines.speaker: u2930
lines.text: All true.

lines.speaker: u2920
lines.text: Well -- what are we going to do about it?!

lines.speaker: u2930
lines.text: I am going to do nothing about it. <u>You</u> are going to sit in the closet.

lines.speaker: u2920
lines.text: The <u>closet</u>?! Have you lost all sense of reality?

lines.speaker: u2930
lines.text: This isn't reality. This is fantasy.

lines.speaker: u2932
lines.text: You okay, Jim? How do you feel?

lines.speaker: u2938
lines.text: Young. I feel young, Doctor.

lines.speaker: u2933
lines.text: David. Please.

lines.speaker: u2935
lines.text: This is just to give us something to do, isn't it?  Come on.

lines.speaker: u2937
lines.text: Well done, Commander.

lines.speaker: u2934
lines.text: You realize, sir, that they will attempt to contact Admiral Kirk and confirm the order.

lines.speaker: u2940
lines.text: What are <u>you</u> looking at?

lines.speaker: u2935
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u2936
lines.text: Yours... is... the superior...

lines.speaker: u2937
lines.text: I shall avenge you --

lines.speaker: u2937
lines.text: Captain... We're waiting. What's the delay?

lines.speaker: u2946
lines.text: All is well, sir. You have the coordinates to beam up Genesis...

lines.speaker: u2937
lines.text: First things first, Captain. Kill Admiral Kirk.

lines.speaker: u2945
lines.text: Phaser lock inoperative, sir.

lines.speaker: u2938
lines.text: Best guess, Mr. Sulu. Fire when ready.

lines.speaker: u2940
lines.text: You lied.

lines.speaker: u2943
lines.text: I exaggerated.

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: I do not understand the final question...

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: You are half human. The Computer knows that.

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: The question is irrelevant.

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: Spock... The retraining of your mind has been in the Vulcan way, so you may not understand feelings. But as my son, you have them. They will surface.

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: As you wish, since you deem them of value. But I cannot wait here to find them.

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: Where must you go?

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: To Earth. To offer testimony.

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: You do this -- for friendship?

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: I do this because I was there,

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: Spock. Does the good of the many outweigh the good of the one...?

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: I would accept that as an axiom.

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: Then you stand here alive because of a mistake -- made by your flawed, feeling, human friends. They have sacrificed their futures because they believed that the good of the <u>one</u> -- you -- was more important to them.

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: Humans make illogical decisions...

lines.speaker: u2949
lines.text: ... They do, indeed.

lines.speaker: u2957
lines.text: You -- sent them away. Without even letting me say goodbye?

lines.speaker: u2950
lines.text: Gillian --

lines.speaker: u2955
lines.text: What's your degree in, dentistry?

lines.speaker: u2951
lines.text: How do you explain slowing pulse, low respiratory rate and coma?

lines.speaker: u2955
lines.text: Fundoscopic examination --

lines.speaker: u2951
lines.text: Fundoscopic examination is unrevealing in these cases!

lines.speaker: u2955
lines.text: A simple evacuation of the expanding epidural hematoma will relieve the pressure.

lines.speaker: u2951
lines.text: My God, man, drilling holes in his head is not the answer. The artery must be repaired without delay or he will die! So put away your butcher knives and let me save the patient!

lines.speaker: u2952
lines.text: Damage report!

lines.speaker: u2965
lines.text: Captain... All systems have failed... We are functioning on reserve power only.

lines.speaker: u2952
lines.text: We're out of control -- Rig for collision...

lines.speaker: u2953
lines.text: The mains are down, sir! Aux power is not responding.

lines.speaker: u2958
lines.text: Mr. Sulu, switch to manual control!

lines.speaker: u2954
lines.text: Status report, Admiral!

lines.speaker: u2960
lines.text: Mr. President, the Probe has passed through all quadrants. The starships Shepard and Yorktown and three smaller vessels have been neutralized.

lines.speaker: u2954
lines.text: "Neutralized?" How?

lines.speaker: u2960
lines.text: We don't know. It's using forms of energy our best scientists do not understand...

lines.speaker: u2954
lines.text: Can you protect us?

lines.speaker: u2960
lines.text: We are launching everything we have.

lines.speaker: u2958
lines.text: Hey! -- Where you going?!

lines.speaker: u2957
lines.text: You're going to your ship, I'm going to mine. Science Vessel. I've got 300 years of catch-up learning to do.

lines.speaker: u2958
lines.text: You mean this is -- goodbye?

lines.speaker: u2957
lines.text: Why does it have to be goodbye?

lines.speaker: u2958
lines.text: Well, I... As they say in your century -- I don't even have your phone number. How will I find you?

lines.speaker: u2957
lines.text: Don't worry. I'll find <u>you</u>.  See you around the galaxy...

lines.speaker: u2958
lines.text: Well, Saavik. I guess this is goodbye.

lines.speaker: u2963
lines.text: Yes, Admiral.  Sir. I have not had the opportunity to tell you about your son.  David died most bravely. He saved Spock. He saved us all... I thought you should know.

lines.speaker: u2964
lines.text: Genesis was perfectly named: The creation of life not death. It was the Klingons who had first blood while trying to possess its secrets.

lines.speaker: u2959
lines.text: Vulcans are well known as the intellectual puppets of the Federation!

lines.speaker: u2964
lines.text: Your vessel did destroy U.S.S. Grissom. Your men did kill Kirk's son. Do you deny these events?

lines.speaker: u2959
lines.text: We deny nothing! We have the right to preserve our race!

lines.speaker: u2964
lines.text: Do you have the right to murder?

lines.speaker: u2961
lines.text: Transparent aluminum?

lines.speaker: u2966
lines.text: That's the ticket, laddie.

lines.speaker: u2961
lines.text: ... But it would take years just to figure out the dynamics of this matrix...!

lines.speaker: u2962
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: u2968
lines.text: Hi. Huey 205, isn't it?

lines.speaker: u2962
lines.text: Right on. You fly?

lines.speaker: u2968
lines.text: Oh, here and there.  I flew something similar in my Academy days.

lines.speaker: u2962
lines.text: All right, then this is old stuff to you.

lines.speaker: u2968
lines.text: Old, yes. But interesting.  Do you mind if I ask a few questions...?

lines.speaker: u2964
lines.text: As I recall, I opposed your enlistment in Starfleet... It is possible that judgment was incorrect.  Your associates are people of good character.

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: They are my friends.

lines.speaker: u2964
lines.text: Yes, of course... Do you have any message for your mother?

lines.speaker: u2967
lines.text: Tell her I feel fine...

lines.speaker: u2968
lines.text: Chotto omachi nasarei. Namae wa nanto moosareruka na.  Wait my son. What is your name?

lines.speaker: u2969
lines.text: Sulu Hikaru.

lines.speaker: u2968
lines.text: Ah, sorenara mazu mazu nagaiki wo sareru to mira.  Ah... Then I am sure that you will have a long and happy life.

lines.speaker: u2969
lines.text: Arigato. Sayonara.  Thank you, honorable sir.

lines.speaker: u2971
lines.text: Do you really think your mighty Federation would be interested in protecting six hundred people?

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: The "mighty" Federation could learn a few things from this village...

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: To many offlanders, what you have here would be more valuable than gold-pressed latinum.  And I'm afraid it's the reason that someone is trying to take this world away from you.

lines.speaker: u2972
lines.text: The artificial lifeform was right?

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: If not for Data, you'd probably have been re-located by now.

lines.speaker: u2973
lines.text: She's stabilizing.

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: Is it safe to move her?

lines.speaker: u2973
lines.text: Safer than leaving her here.

lines.speaker: u2974
lines.text: I'm showing fresh air  behind this calcite formation, Captain...

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: Will the structure hold if we blast through?

lines.speaker: u2974
lines.text: I believe it is safe, sir.

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: I wonder... which one of us will be facing that court-martial...

lines.speaker: u2975
lines.text: There's nothing further to be gained from this...

lines.speaker: u2984
lines.text: Separate the Starfleet personnel and secure them in the aft cargo hold... see that Picard joins them...

lines.speaker: u2976
lines.text: The shields in that section won't protect them against the thermolytic reaction...

lines.speaker: u2984
lines.text: Thank-you for reminding me.

lines.speaker: u2977
lines.text: I wouldn't be surprised if history remembers this as the Riker Maneuver...

lines.speaker: u2983
lines.text: If it works you mean.

lines.speaker: u2977
lines.text: Even if it doesn't, they'll be teaching kids as the Academy not to do this for years to come.

lines.speaker: u2982
lines.text: The purpose being I intend to shove it down the Son'a's throat.

lines.speaker: u2978
lines.text: Commander, if one of their weapons hits that gas...

lines.speaker: u2982
lines.text: It's our only way out of here, Mister Nara.

lines.speaker: u2979
lines.text: They're powering their forward weapons array.

lines.speaker: u2982
lines.text: Blow out the ramscoop. Stand by full thrusters.

lines.speaker: u2980
lines.text: Counselor?

lines.speaker: u2987
lines.text: They have an incredible clarity of perception, Captain. I've never encountered a species with such mental discipline...

lines.speaker: u2982
lines.text: All hands. Battle stations!

lines.speaker: u2987
lines.text: And have you noticed how your boobs have started to firm up?

lines.speaker: u2984
lines.text: This ship is equipped with fourteen long range transporters... are they all useless...?

lines.speaker: u2986
lines.text: They must have been locked and secured after we were beamed here.

lines.speaker: u2984
lines.text: Isolate one and re-route its command sequence through the auxiliary processor...

lines.speaker: u2997
lines.text: Admiral... what's the status of the Borg fleet?

lines.speaker: u2990
lines.text: It's been destroyed. The Borg threat is over.  Are you all right? The Enterprise disappeared from our sensors for a moment.

lines.speaker: u2997
lines.text: We're fine, sir. It will take some... time to explain.

lines.speaker: u2990
lines.text: I look forward to reading your report.

lines.speaker: u2991
lines.text: The occipital fracture is widening... we're going to have to fuse the bones...

lines.speaker: u2994
lines.text: I'm a little worried about some of these bone fragments. If they move any closer to the brain, we could be looking at a hemorrhage.

lines.speaker: u2992
lines.text: Your diagnostics are in error. I need weapons.

lines.speaker: u2993
lines.text: The problem must lie in the interface between Starfleet and Borg technology. Your console may not be configured to handle the data flow.

lines.speaker: u2992
lines.text: Can you configure it?

lines.speaker: u2993
lines.text: I believe so.

lines.speaker: u2992
lines.text: Do it.

lines.speaker: u2993
lines.text: No. Human beings do not have that luxury, and neither should I.

lines.speaker: u3003
lines.text: I will admit... there are times when I wish I had an emotion chip I could turn on and off.

lines.speaker: u2994
lines.text: What did you do to the batteries?

lines.speaker: u2997
lines.text: Oh... just a little tinkering. How is he?

lines.speaker: u2995
lines.text: They're getting awfully close... what the hell are they doing?

lines.speaker: u2997
lines.text: We're crossing the threshold!

lines.speaker: u2996
lines.text: ATR setting...

lines.speaker: u2998
lines.text: Active.

lines.speaker: u2996
lines.text: Main bus...

lines.speaker: u2998
lines.text: Ready.

lines.speaker: u2996
lines.text: Initiate pre-ignition sequence.

lines.speaker: u2999
lines.text: Yes, sir. But Captain... are we... all going back?

lines.speaker: u2997
lines.text: Unless you'd like to stay.

lines.speaker: u2999
lines.text: No, sir.

lines.speaker: u3003
lines.text: I have to admit there was a moment there when --

lines.speaker: u2999
lines.text: Hold that thought.

lines.speaker: u3000
lines.text: What the hell happened down there, Worf?

lines.speaker: u3005
lines.text: Commander... we have a problem.

lines.speaker: u3003
lines.text: They may be trying to send a message to the other Borg...the Borg in this time period...

lines.speaker: u3005
lines.text: What kind of message?

lines.speaker: u3017
lines.text: I'd prefer not to be the President to push the button if I can avoid it.

lines.speaker: u3006
lines.text: The longer we wait, the less accessible the hostages will be, Mr. President.

lines.speaker: u3017
lines.text: I'll bear it in mind, Admiral. I think that's all.

lines.speaker: u3014
lines.text: It takes a lot of effort.

lines.speaker: u3007
lines.text: I don't wonder. Stop me if I'm wrong but do we really have any way of knowing if this is the real you?

lines.speaker: u3014
lines.text: I thought I would assume a pleasing shape.  We're outside the shield. Now it's your turn, Kirk.

lines.speaker: u3012
lines.text: As Captain I am responsible for the conduct of the crew under my command.

lines.speaker: u3008
lines.text: Your honors, the State rests.

lines.speaker: u3020
lines.text: You must have cursed yourself, for having programmed our data banks, Lieutenant. Only they revealed something wrong aboard Enterprise.

lines.speaker: u3009
lines.text: She programmed the torpedo hits?

lines.speaker: u3021
lines.text: Send to commander Enterprise: "We stand ready to assist you. Captain Sulu, USS Excelsior." Attach our co-ordinates.

lines.speaker: u3010
lines.text: Is that wise, sir? I mean, given their situation -  Aye, sir.

lines.speaker: u3011
lines.text: Thank you, Captain Kirk. The evening has been most... edifying.

lines.speaker: u3012
lines.text: We must do this again soon.

lines.speaker: u3022
lines.text: Captain, we can't see her, but she gives off heat...

lines.speaker: u3012
lines.text: Not from a distance. She won't show up on ANY type of scan.

lines.speaker: u3022
lines.text: We can send a message to Starfleet Command -

lines.speaker: u3013
lines.text: I do not think so. Enterprise has disobeyed orders and harbors two escaped convicts. Admiral Donald will make certain all your ship-to- shore transmissions are jammed.

lines.speaker: u3016
lines.text: Sorry to wake you, sir, but Starfleet urgently requests any data we may have on the whereabouts of Enterprise.

lines.speaker: u3021
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3016
lines.text: Apparently they're refusing to acknowledge signal to return to spacedock, sir.

lines.speaker: u3021
lines.text: Signal Starfleet that... we have no idea location of Enterprise.

lines.speaker: u3016
lines.text: Sir?

lines.speaker: u3021
lines.text: You having hearing problems, mister?

lines.speaker: u3016
lines.text: No, sir.

lines.speaker: u3021
lines.text: Praxis?

lines.speaker: u3018
lines.text: What's left of it.

lines.speaker: u3020
lines.text: They're outside the beaming shield. Mr. Scott, start your engines.

lines.speaker: u3019
lines.text: Aye, aye, sir.

lines.speaker: u3022
lines.text: They might as well arrest me, too; I felt like Lieutenant Saavik.

lines.speaker: u3020
lines.text: But you didn't join a conspiracy.

lines.speaker: u3025
lines.text: Do you know anything about Shinzon's plans against the Federation?

lines.speaker: u3023
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3025
lines.text: Do you have any knowledge of the tactical abi1ities of this ship?

lines.speaker: u3023
lines.text: No. Can I move now?

lines.speaker: u3025
lines.text: No. I must deactivate you.

lines.speaker: u3023
lines.text: For how long?

lines.speaker: u3025
lines.text: Indefinitely.

lines.speaker: u3023
lines.text: How long is that?

lines.speaker: u3024
lines.text: You can' t imagine them, Jean Luc. They're kids! All with advance degrees in xenobiology and out to conquer every disease in the quadrant.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Reminds me of a young doctor I used to know...

lines.speaker: u3024
lines.text: They're running me ragged. Nothing but question day and night... I love it! Come to dinner and 1'1 tell you all about it. There's a Bajoran band at the officer's mess.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Not tonight, I have work here.

lines.speaker: u3024
lines.text: Soon then.  IÂ’ll save the last dance for you.

lines.speaker: u3037
lines.text: If you wouldn't mind.

lines.speaker: u3025
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u3026
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: I can feel your desire, Deanna.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Open a channel.

lines.speaker: u3027
lines.text: This is Commander Donatra of the Valdore. We're dispatching shuttles with medical personnel and supplies.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Thank you, Commander.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Geordi... prepare the shuttle- bay for arrivals. They don't know our procedures so just... open the doors.

lines.speaker: u3028
lines.text: I'll take care of it, sir.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Number One.  You have the bridge.

lines.speaker: u3030
lines.text: Believe me, we don't under- stand it either. You're the closest ship so I want you to high tail it over there and hear what he has to say. Get the lay of the land, If the Empire becomes unstable, it could mean trouble for the entire quadrant.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Understood.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Not with the Romulans.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: Just lucky, Admiral.

lines.speaker: u3030
lines.text: Let's hope that luck holds. Janeway out.

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: I hope you're still alive, Jean Luc.

lines.speaker: u3031
lines.text: I am.

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: Don't you think it's time to surrender? I'll have my cloak back in a matter of minutes and your poor ship is shot to pieces. Why should the rest of your crew have to die?

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: Deploy the weapon. Kill everything on that ship. Then set a course for Earth.

lines.speaker: u3032
lines.text: What about Picard?

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: Our greater goal is more important, brother.

lines.speaker: u3032
lines.text: But, Praetor, you won't survive without him...

lines.speaker: u3037
lines.text: Intruder alert!

lines.speaker: u3033
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: Commander Suran, the games are over. In two days the Federation will be crippled beyond repair. Does that satisfy you?

lines.speaker: u3035
lines.text: For the moment.

lines.speaker: u3034
lines.text: And when I return... you and I shall have a little talk about showing proper respect!

lines.speaker: u3047
lines.text: Mike, call for back-up.  Benny, you all right?

lines.speaker: u3038
lines.text: I don't think so...

lines.speaker: u3047
lines.text: Benny, this is me. I'm going to take a look.

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: Do you have a good map of Death Valley?

lines.speaker: u3039
lines.text: We should have. Let me see.

lines.speaker: u3040
lines.text: Well, here we are... You go down that ramp there, you're sure to get a ride.

lines.speaker: u3050
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u3040
lines.text: And don't be shy about your English. You speak better than a lot of people I know.  Take care of yourself.

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: Where did you stop last?

lines.speaker: u3041
lines.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: Where did you stop last?

lines.speaker: u3041
lines.text: Stay right there...

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: What was your last stop?

lines.speaker: u3041
lines.text: Elmo's...

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: Where's that?

lines.speaker: u3041
lines.text: About five miles back.

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: I won't let anyone hurt you.

lines.speaker: u3042
lines.text: Watch it. They're coming out.

lines.speaker: u3051
lines.text: I have nothing to do. I'd like to help you.

lines.speaker: u3043
lines.text: Don't worry. I'll be all right.

lines.speaker: u3045
lines.text: They're gonna let some local cop blow him away.

lines.speaker: u3044
lines.text: Save us all a lot of trouble.

lines.speaker: u3045
lines.text: Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.

lines.speaker: u3044
lines.text: Bullshit!

lines.speaker: u3045
lines.text: You have no conception of this, do you?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Sorry, sir. I didn't mean that.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Physical? Criminal?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Also clean.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Age?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Twenty-six.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Education?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Some. Here and there.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Military record?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Honorable discharge. May 1971.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: You moonlightin?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: No, I want long shifts.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: We hire a lot of moonlighters here.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: So I hear.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Hell, we ain't that much fussy anyway. There's always opening on one fleet or another.  Fill out these forms and give them to the girl at the desk, and leave your phone number. You gotta phone?

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3135
lines.text: Well then check back tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Yes, Sir.

lines.speaker: u3136
lines.text: Look, um, if you give me your name and address, we'll send you the information on how to apply.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: You would, huh?

lines.speaker: u3136
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: My name is Henry Krinkle -- that's with a "K." K-R-I-N-K-L-E. I live at 13 1/2 Hopper Avenue, Fair Lawn, New Jersey. Zip code 07410.  Got that?

lines.speaker: u3136
lines.text: Sure, Henry. I got it all. We'll send you all the stuff all right.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Great, hey. Thanks a lot.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Get it.

lines.speaker: u3137
lines.text: Hey, mister, I don't know what's going on here. This don't make any sense.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Show it to me.

lines.speaker: u3140
lines.text: Look, a person does a certain thing and that's all there is to it. It becomes what he is. Why fight it? What do you know? How long you been a hack, a couple months? You're like a peg and you get dropped into a slot and you got to squirm and wiggle around a while until you fit in.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: That's just about the dumbest thing I ever heard, Wizard.

lines.speaker: u3140
lines.text: What do you expect, Bertrand Russell? I've been a cabbie all my life, what do I know?  I don't even know what you're talking about.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Neither do I, I guess.

lines.speaker: u3140
lines.text: You fit in. It's lonely, it's rough at first. But you fit in. You got no choice.

lines.speaker: u3140
lines.text: Yeah. Sorry, Wizard.

lines.speaker: u3140
lines.text: Don't worry, Killer. You'll be all right.  I seen enough to know.

lines.speaker: u3139
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u3141
lines.text: Don't stop...  do no stop.

lines.speaker: u3142
lines.text: Shit, shit, shit what time is it.  Hello.  I'll be downstairs in ten minutes.

lines.speaker: u3143
lines.text: St. Michael's Church, Fort Walton, Kansas.  Front pew.  Right leg. = Hollow.

lines.speaker: u3142
lines.text: What's that?  Mason?

lines.speaker: u3154
lines.text: Delly, shhhhhh...

lines.speaker: u3145
lines.text: No... I can't... I have to... I can't...

lines.speaker: u3146
lines.text: Are you now, or have you ever been, a member of the communist party?

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: No, sir.

lines.speaker: u3146
lines.text: Are you refuting this evidence and your previous testimony?

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: I'm not refuting anything.

lines.speaker: u3146
lines.text: Yet you're contradicting yourself. You earlier testified that you attended a meeting of a communist party-run organization, yet you just said, under oath, that you were not now -- nor ever -- a member of the communist party.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: That's not a contradiction at all, sir.  I went to the meeting, but I didn't go as a member.

lines.speaker: u3146
lines.text: Well, then, as what did you go?

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: Mr. Chairman... there's... another Amendment... that I'd like to invoke at this time, but it's not the Fifth Amendment.  I wonder if you're familiar with it.

lines.speaker: u3147
lines.text: Mr. Appleton, you will...

lines.speaker: u3148
lines.text: Well, no, but these gentlemen would like to get some answers...

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: I don't know what else to tell you. I wasn't hiding out.  I hit my head and I didn't remember anything until a few days ago.

lines.speaker: u3149
lines.text: So... you do intend to fix the place up after all?

lines.speaker: u3154
lines.text: Mr. Fitts, with all due respect, I think Lawson needs the Bijou a bit more than it needs a super market. And I think Lawson deserves the Bijou.  There's not a lot that can be done to help us get past the pain we've all felt...

lines.speaker: u3150
lines.text: I'm not happy about this, mind you, but if I have to go, at least I'm going in my own bed, the same bed my Lily died in, and... knowing that my son is alive.  That's not too shabby, is it?

lines.speaker: u3154
lines.text: You're not going anywhere, Harry.

lines.speaker: u3150
lines.text: Don't tell me, I know about these things.  I've seen it before.  It's all right.  It's... all right. You're here.  Oh, God, I love you, son.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: 'Sides, car's right outside.  I'll be seein' ya, Jer.

lines.speaker: u3151
lines.text: Pete...

lines.speaker: u3152
lines.text: It's a pretty massive heart attack. His lungs have filled with fluid, and, well... it seems as though his body is just... shutting down.

lines.speaker: u3154
lines.text: Can we get him to the hospital?

lines.speaker: u3152
lines.text: Even if we could, and the move didn't kill him, there'd be very little we could do there that we can't do here.  I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: Her name was right there in front of them.  They gave it to me, I didn't give it to them.

lines.speaker: u3153
lines.text: Well, that's not what they think.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: Leo, she was... she was a girl I knew in college...

lines.speaker: u3153
lines.text: You should keep track of your old school chums.  Turns out she eventually joined the communist party.  On top of which, she's Lucy Angstrom Hirschfeld now, and she happens to be a writer for "Studio One" on CBS.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: Oh god, oh, god, no, I...

lines.speaker: u3153
lines.text: So, our lawyers had a talk with the Committee's lawyers.  That Elvin Clyde fella won't be too happy about it, but we cut a deal. They cleared you -- and they're gonna thank you publicly for your testimony purging yourself.

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: Thank me publicly?  For what?  For ruining this woman's life?

lines.speaker: u3153
lines.text: Climb down off your cross.  They already knew about her.  She was subpoenaed six months ago! Who the hell do you think named you?

lines.speaker: u3156
lines.text: That's my r-r-rent.

lines.speaker: u3154
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: u3156
lines.text: Did you think I didn't kn-kn-know that?

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: I thought you...

lines.speaker: u3156
lines.text: I know more than you give me c-c- credit, that's for sure.  Don't you see, it don't m-m-matter who you are?  All that matters is what you g-g-gave us.  And you can't take that away now.  You're wrong, Peter Appleton.  You do belong here.

lines.speaker: u3159
lines.text: Mr. Appleton, I have reason to believe you're holding something back, and that just rubs me the wrong way.  Sir, are you a communist?

lines.speaker: u3157
lines.text: No.  Absolutely not.

lines.speaker: u3159
lines.text: All right.  All right.  We'll see.

lines.speaker: u3162
lines.text: Is anyone there?

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Look.

lines.speaker: u3162
lines.text: Ohhh. Oh, the poor thing. He probably lost his way in the dark.

lines.speaker: u3163
lines.text: Mitch?  Do... do you think they'll be all right? In the trunk? Can they breath?

lines.speaker: u3172
lines.text: I think they'll be all right, honey.

lines.text: How much for the phone calls?

lines.speaker: u3164
lines.text: It's nothing.

lines.text: Gulls!

lines.text: They're back!

lines.text: Here's your pie, Sebastian. You want it at the table?

lines.text: No. Here's fine.

lines.speaker: u3167
lines.text: Where are the Bloody Marys, Deke?

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Please don't mess me up with bandages, Mrs. Brenner.

lines.speaker: u3168
lines.text: Shhhh. Shhhh.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Please.

lines.speaker: u3169
lines.text: There's an ordinance against burning anything in this town, unless it's...

lines.speaker: u3172
lines.text: We'll use smoke pots. Like the Army uses.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Well, where did he go?

lines.speaker: u3170
lines.text: Bodega Bay. He goes up there every weekend.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Bodega Bay? Where's that?

lines.speaker: u3170
lines.text: Up on the coast. About sixty miles north of here.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Sixty...  Oh.

lines.speaker: u3170
lines.text: About an hour and a half on the freeway. Or two if you take the coast highway.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: u3170
lines.text: I'd hold the birds for him, but I'm going away myself. Someone's got to feed them, I suppose.

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Yes. Yes, someone's got to feed them.

lines.speaker: u3170
lines.text: I'm awfully sorry.

lines.speaker: u3173
lines.text: And what? Vultures? Hawks? Eagles?

lines.speaker: u3171
lines.text: Maybe! Is it impossible?

lines.speaker: u3173
lines.text: Yes. I have never known birds of different species to flock together. The very concept is unimaginable.  Why if that happened, we wouldn't have a chance. How could we possible hope to fight them?

lines.speaker: u3176
lines.text: How can we go on living here if we blanket the town with smoke?

lines.speaker: u3172
lines.text: Can we go on living here otherwise?

lines.speaker: u3176
lines.text: Actually, those gulls must have been after the fish.

lines.speaker: u3173
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: u3176
lines.text: Makes a lot more sense than... well, an attack.

lines.speaker: u3173
lines.text: Of course it does. If we believe that birds are attacking, why... why next we'll believe that grasshoppers and cockroaches are capable of...

lines.speaker: u3177
lines.text: I'm leaving! Are you coming?

lines.speaker: u3175
lines.text: All right, all right!  Hope you figure this out, folks.

lines.speaker: u3178
lines.text: Not much danger here, ma'am, I wouldn't think -- right here in the heart of Edinburgh.

lines.speaker: u3184
lines.text: They're uncommon bold, the grave robbers -- and the daft doctors who drive them on.

lines.speaker: u3178
lines.text: I'm by way of being a medical myself.

lines.speaker: u3184
lines.text: A doctor?

lines.speaker: u3178
lines.text: A student.  I'm studying under Dr. MacFarlane -- that is, I've been studying until today --

lines.speaker: u3181
lines.text: I don't understand the song. Tell me plain how they did it.

lines.speaker: u3180
lines.text: I'll show you how it was done, Joseph. -- I'll show you how they "Burked" them.

lines.speaker: u3183
lines.text: You've been with Gray again.

lines.speaker: u3182
lines.text: Aye.

lines.speaker: u3189
lines.text: In the woods you said you had nothing. But you wouldn't, and I wouldn't if there's some way you don't have to go. Please. At least not right away.

lines.speaker: u3186
lines.text: Erin. I'll always be with you.

lines.speaker: u3187
lines.text: I watched her grow up. Just like you. I know how her mind worked. She kept snooping around because she was worried about you. What you'd gotten yourself into. So stop blaming me. And blame yourself.

lines.speaker: u3192
lines.text: I do. Every day.

lines.speaker: u3187
lines.text: Erin knows, doesn't she?

lines.speaker: u3195
lines.text: You want me to walk a straight line?

lines.speaker: u3188
lines.text: I want you... to bend over.

lines.speaker: u3195
lines.text: Look, can I just call a cab?

lines.speaker: u3188
lines.text: What did I say?

lines.speaker: u3192
lines.text: I would never hurt you or Lauren. Never. Believe me.

lines.speaker: u3189
lines.text: I don't believe you.

lines.speaker: u3192
lines.text: Please. Come inside.

lines.speaker: u3189
lines.text: I'm never going back in that house again. Get away.

lines.speaker: u3197
lines.text: The people who came to the meeting must be made to realize this. They must understand what is at stake.  You mentioned a demonstration of force--

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3197
lines.text: Would such, a demonstration be possible before the meeting?

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Yes -- of course.

lines.speaker: u3197
lines.text: Something that would dramatize for them and for their people the seriousness of the situation. Something that would affect the entire planet.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: That can easily be arranged.

lines.speaker: u3197
lines.text: I wouldn't want you to harm anybody -- or destroy anything.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Why don't you leave it to me? I'll think of something.

lines.speaker: u3197
lines.text: Maybe a little demonstration.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Something dramatic -- but not destructive.  It's quite an interesting problem.  Would day after tomorrow be all right? Say about noon?

lines.speaker: u3198
lines.text: What do you want it for, Mr. Carpenter?

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Why -- the light in my room went out.  Thank you, Bobby. Goodnight.

lines.speaker: u3206
lines.text: The skeletal structure is completely normal.  Same for the major organs -Â– heart, liver, spleen, kidneys.

lines.speaker: u3199
lines.text: And the lungs are the same as ours. Must mean a similar atmosphere -- similar pressure.  How old do you think he is?

lines.speaker: u3206
lines.text: Oh, I'd say forty-five.

lines.speaker: u3199
lines.text: He told me this morning when I examined him. He's seventy-eight.

lines.speaker: u3206
lines.text: I don't believe it.

lines.speaker: u3199
lines.text: Their life expectancy is a hundred and thirty.

lines.speaker: u3206
lines.text: How does he explain that?

lines.speaker: u3199
lines.text: He says their medicine is that much more advanced.  He was very nice about it. But he made me feel like a third-class witch doctor.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: Before making any decisions, I think I should get out among your people -- become familiar with the basis for these strange, unreasoning attitudes.

lines.speaker: u3200
lines.text: Under the circumstances I'm afraid that will be impossible.

lines.speaker: u3201
lines.text: We'll miss you very much -- Bobby and I.  He won't have anyone to play with.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: He'll have you -- and Tom.

lines.speaker: u3201
lines.text: No. That's all finished.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u3201
lines.text: I think I'm very lucky. You don't always get a chance to recognize a mistake before you make it.

lines.speaker: u3202
lines.text: How dare you write on that blackboard!  Do you realize the Professor has been working on that problem for weeks?

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: He'll catch on to it in no time now.

lines.speaker: u3202
lines.text: How did you get in here? And what do you want?

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: We came to see Professor Barnhardt.

lines.speaker: u3202
lines.text: Well, he's not here. And he won't be back till this evening.  I think you'd better leave now. Unruffled, Klaatu turns to the desk and scribbles something on a scratch pad. He tears off the piece of paper and hands it to Hilda.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: You might keep this.  I think the professor will want to get in touch with me.

lines.speaker: u3207
lines.text: You sure about that?

lines.speaker: u3203
lines.text: Would you like to sell it?

lines.speaker: u3207
lines.text: No -- no, thanks.

lines.speaker: u3203
lines.text: I'd give you a very good price.

lines.speaker: u3204
lines.text: May I suggest that you call the Professor?

lines.speaker: u3205
lines.text: Get going, will you, Brady -- before I get mad!

lines.speaker: u3208

lines.text: We are awesome monster-bashers!

lines.speaker: u3208
lines.text: The meanest!

lines.text: The baddest!

lines.text: You can't kill me, Star.

lines.speaker: u3209
lines.text: No, Star.  Put it down.  Put it down.

lines.text: Don't go out there!  Stop him!

lines.text: Sam, don't --

lines.text: Grandpa, the Widow Johnson called. She said to pick her up a seven instead of eight.

lines.text: Did we have a date tonight?

lines.speaker: u3216
lines.text: I guess so.  She said not to be late.

lines.speaker: u3211
lines.text: I better get cleaned up, then.

lines.speaker: u3212
lines.text: You like Michael.

lines.speaker: u3217
lines.text: I like Michael.

lines.speaker: u3212
lines.text: You better not like him too much.

lines.speaker: u3213
lines.text: Will somebody please tell me what this is all about!?

lines.speaker: u3214
lines.text: It's you I was after all along, Lucy.  To be our day time guardian. I knew if we could bring Sam and Michael into the faimly, there'd be no way you could say no.

lines.speaker: u3216
lines.text: But you passed the test!

lines.speaker: u3214
lines.text: Michael invited me in.  Never invite a vampire into your house. It renders you powerless.

lines.speaker: u3216
lines.text: What?!  Did you know that!?

lines.speaker: u3216
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.speaker: u3215
lines.text: I... I don't feel any differently.  Do you?

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Where these tracks headed?

lines.speaker: u3218
lines.text: Nowhere... Just straight to the ocean.

lines.speaker: u3219
lines.text: I've changed my mind... I'd... I'd like to come back inside... I don't want to stay out here any more... Funny things... I hear funny things out here.

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Have you come across Fuchs?

lines.speaker: u3219
lines.text: Fuchs...?  No, it's not Fuchs... You must let me back in... I won't harm anyone... I promise...

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: We'll see...

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Maybe we shouldn't make it.

lines.speaker: u3220
lines.text: If you're worried about anything, let's take that blood test of yours.

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: If we've got any surprises for each other -- we shouldn't be in any condition to do anything about it.  You play chess?

lines.speaker: u3222
lines.text: I'm getting worried about you.  You ought to have a checkup.

lines.speaker: u3227
lines.text: Let's just not get worried about anything just now.

lines.speaker: u3222
lines.text: After all this mess then.

lines.speaker: u3227
lines.text: After all this mess.

lines.speaker: u3223
lines.text: Right.  Why not?

lines.speaker: u3224
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: u3224
lines.text: How long's it been?

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Little over two hours.

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: What's happened?!

lines.speaker: u3227
lines.text: MacReady, that you?

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: u3227
lines.text: It's the generator I think!  No power.

lines.speaker: u3225
lines.text: Well, let's get down there.

lines.speaker: u3226
lines.text: It's got into the pub!  It's turned on the stereo!

lines.speaker: u3229
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: u3226
lines.text: It's in between us and them!!  How we going to get back?!

lines.speaker: u3229
lines.text: Can't hear you.

lines.speaker: u3230
lines.text: You won't even try?

lines.speaker: u3234
lines.text: We can't change the day and the night, Alexander.  This is the world.

lines.speaker: u3239
lines.text: If I might explain, sir --

lines.speaker: u3231
lines.text: You supported his application, Dr. Philby.  You are his senior, advisor.  I depend upon you to restrain his... excesses.  Any repetition of the behavior I witnessed in his classroom today and there will be consequences for you both.

lines.speaker: u3239
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u3231
lines.text: Now you are upsetting my fowl. Please go.

lines.speaker: u3235
lines.text: Kalen, it's all right, I'm here --

lines.speaker: u3233
lines.text: They're here!  They're inside the house -- !

lines.speaker: u3235
lines.text: No, you're safe --

lines.speaker: u3233
lines.text: They're inside --

lines.speaker: u3235
lines.text: Kalen, look at me.  There's no one here but us.  You see... I'm here, you're here, Alexander's here. There are no Morlocks.  It was just a dream...

lines.speaker: u3237
lines.text: I think I might be.  But there'll be some changes made.  I run a tight house.

lines.speaker: u3239
lines.text: I have no doubt of that.  I'll come by in the morning and we'll arrange it.  Goodnight, Mrs. Watchit.

lines.speaker: u3237
lines.text: Goodnight, Mr. Philby.

lines.text: How did you come to know their names?

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: You just told me. The last time I was with you was when I was in the Jacket. I'm in it right now, Dr. Becker.

lines.speaker: u3243
lines.text: I don't understand...

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: I'm in it as we speak. [Beat] You're haunting yourself right now. [Beat] I guess sometimes we indict ourselves if no one else does. You didn't make history like you wanted to, huh, Dr. Becker. It turned out different, didn't it?

lines.speaker: u3243
lines.text: I didn't put you in Alpine Grove.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: No. [Beat] You put me on drugs and then you put me in the Jacket.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: He died because he bled to death from a blow to his head. Someone had to have given him it.

lines.speaker: u3244
lines.text: I never touched your father! I swear!

lines.speaker: u3250
lines.text: Where? [Beat] It's Becker isn't it? He's doing stuff, isn't he?

lines.speaker: u3245
lines.text: Later. I'll tell you about it later. We got a session to catch now.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: I need to get this letter to someone.

lines.speaker: u3246
lines.text: I can't take you out of here in your condition...

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: And I can't stay here in my condition. I am going to die tonight. It's already been decided.

lines.speaker: u3246
lines.text: No, it hasn't.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: Yes. [Beat] It has. Everything up 'till today is done. Everything starting with tomorrow is up for grabs.

lines.speaker: u3247
lines.text: I'm sorry I can't tell you more about your father's death, Mr. Starks. Our own medical examiners determined only that he died from a blunt trauma to the head but that was right around the time the Alpine Grove's staff changed and I'm afraid we didn't have the best record system before then.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: His body was found on January 1, 1993, but do you know if that was long after he had died?

lines.speaker: u3247
lines.text: No, I don't. I'm sorry. I wish I knew more.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: What about Dr. Thomas Becker or Dr. Loel Lorenson? There was also a Dr. Gries, I think.

lines.speaker: u3247
lines.text: Well, Dr. Lorenson is still here at the hospital. If she was here at the time your father was, then I'm sure she'd be of more help to you.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: What about Dr. Becker and Mr. Gries?

lines.speaker: u3247
lines.text: Unfortunately, I'm not familiar with Dr. Becker and Dr. Gries passed away three, four years ago.

lines.speaker: u3248
lines.text: Because Becker resigned after the charges brought against him by State Patient Advocacy Groups.

lines.speaker: u3250
lines.text: I see you've done your homework. [Beat] Alpine Grove's undergone a lot of changes since then. At the time, we didn't have the...resources to help our patients the way we needed to. [Beat] Now, we do. And things are different.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: You know how to get there?

lines.speaker: u3250
lines.text: Sure. It's an easy address. A little far out there, but easy enough.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: MacKenzie, [beat] what if we are crazy?

lines.speaker: u3251
lines.text: [Shrugging] What if we are? There're crazier things than thinking up fictions for yourself. [Beat] Everyone does it, don't they? Even Becker. That roller coaster car pops more pills than all of Ward 3.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: Becker does? Are you sure?

lines.speaker: u3251
lines.text: I've been here for 11 years. It's my neighborhood. 'Course I'm sure. He's as drugged up as the rest of us...I guess he has to be to put up with all this.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u3254
lines.text: Yeah, me too. [Softly] Every day for the last ten years.

lines.speaker: u3252
lines.text: That when you stopped being a nurse?

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: Darryl.

lines.speaker: u3255
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: Go fuck yourself.

lines.speaker: u3256
lines.text: I'm sorry to bother you, I know you're real busy right now, but how many times, Max?  How many times has that woman gotta be fucked over? You could lift one finger and save her ass and you won't even do that?

lines.speaker: u3263
lines.text: Get a hold of yourself!  You are way out of your jurisdiction, now come on!  Calm down!  Don't make me sorry I let you come!

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: Don't hurt me.  Harlan.  Please.

lines.speaker: u3257
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: You're kinda the best thing that's happened to me in a long time.

lines.speaker: u3258
lines.text: You're a little angle, you are.

lines.speaker: u3259
lines.text: Don't worry darlin'.  I'll say I never found you.  I'll say anything you want.  We'll find a way to get you out of this, whatever it is.

lines.speaker: u3261
lines.text: Damn, Jimmy, did you take a pill that makes you say all the right stuff?

lines.speaker: u3259
lines.text: I'm choking on it.

lines.speaker: u3261
lines.text: Are you going to apologize or not?

lines.speaker: u3267
lines.text: Fuck you.

lines.speaker: u3267
lines.text: Oh, Jesus!

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: You probably even called us beavers on your CB radio, didn't you?

lines.speaker: u3267
lines.text: Yeah... sure did.

lines.speaker: u3266
lines.text: Damn.  I hate that!  I hate bein' called a beaver, don't you?

lines.speaker: u3268
lines.text: Hey, shit-for-brains, be careful not to scratch that thing, huh?

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3268
lines.text: You heard me. You already put a fucking nick in my piano.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: I'll try to be more careful.

lines.speaker: u3268
lines.text: S'matter with you? You look like you're fading.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: The thing's kind of heavy.

lines.speaker: u3268
lines.text: Heavy? Heavy?! What I wouldn't give to know what heavy feels like, you insensitive prick.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: No, I just meant...

lines.speaker: u3268
lines.text: Yeah yeah. I'm going to the corner to get a cup of coffee.

lines.speaker: u3269
lines.text: No harm, no foul?

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: I guess.

lines.speaker: u3270
lines.text: Dom Wooganowski. Duh.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: But but you're married. You have kids a great wife.

lines.speaker: u3270
lines.text: If you're so happy with them, please, be my guest.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: A convention? How'd you see her at a convention?

lines.speaker: u3271
lines.text: I'm an orthopedic surgeon, she's an orthopedic surgeon.

lines.speaker: u3272
lines.text: I got twenty bucks says you're full of shit.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: Oh come on, why would I lie?

lines.speaker: u3272
lines.text: Because you're a loser, and in some warped way this gives you a momentary sense of worth.

lines.speaker: u3273
lines.text: Oh... Sully.

lines.speaker: u3284
lines.text: Look, if it wasn't you who sent the letter, and it wasn't me who sent it?

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: I see where you're going.

lines.speaker: u3274
lines.text: Think about it. You walk into a video store and you see Eight-Minute Abs and right next to it you see Seven- Minute Abs -- which one you gonna spring for?

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: I'd go with the seven.

lines.speaker: u3274
lines.text: Bingo. Especially since we guarantee you'll get every bit as good a work- out.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: How do you guarantee that?

lines.speaker: u3274
lines.text: Well it's the company motto: 'If you ain't happy we'll send you the extra minute.'

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: Huh. That sounds great.  Unless someone else comes out with Six-Minute Abs.

lines.speaker: u3275
lines.text: What? Steve seemed to put up with Warren.

lines.speaker: u3277
lines.text: I don't want someone who'll put up with him. I want someone who will enjoy him, the way I do. Do you know what he told my friend Tucker? He said he would've popped the question a lot earlier if Warren wasn't in my life.  Well he is in my life and I'm goddamn lucky to have him. The hell with Steve.

lines.speaker: u3276
lines.text: Oh, hi hon. Just straightening up.

lines.speaker: u3277
lines.text: Where's Puffy?

lines.speaker: u3276
lines.text: Ah, he was being a pest so I put him in the bathroom.

lines.speaker: u3277
lines.text: Get over here.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: u3277
lines.text: Really.

lines.speaker: u3278
lines.text: You're looking at him. C'mere and take a look at this beauty.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: No, that's really unneces --

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: No, no, please!

lines.speaker: u3279
lines.text: Teddy, be brave.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: No! I was pissing!

lines.speaker: u3280
lines.text: Yeah, I'll bet you all were. Come on, in the truck.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: Okay.  So is that a yes or a no?

lines.speaker: u3281
lines.text: I think I was very clear, Ted. If everything else falls apart, maybe.

lines.speaker: u3283
lines.text: See you, Warren.

lines.speaker: u3285
lines.text: Bye, Ted.

lines.speaker: u3296
lines.text: I believe the President made it clear that there would be no firing on ships without his express permission.

lines.speaker: u3286
lines.text: With all due respect, Mr. Secretary, we were not firing on the ship. Firing on a ship means attacking the ship. We were not attacking the ship. We were firing over it.

lines.speaker: u3296
lines.text: This was not the President's intention when he gave that order. What if the Soviets don't see the distention? What if they make the same mistake I just did?  There will be no firing anything near ANY Soviet ships without my express permission, is that understood, Admiral?

lines.speaker: u3286
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u3296
lines.text: And I will only issue such instructions when ordered to by the President.  John Paul Jones... you don't understand a thing, do you, Admiral?

lines.speaker: u3293
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u3287
lines.text: Kenny. It's over.

lines.speaker: u3293
lines.text: Every day the sun comes up... says something about us.

lines.speaker: u3288
lines.text: Says what, Kenny?

lines.speaker: u3290
lines.text: John. How much time?

lines.speaker: u3298
lines.text: 48 hours. In 48 hours there can be no deals.

lines.speaker: u3299
lines.text: Does this attack on our plane represent a definitive, intentional escalation on the part of the Soviets?

lines.speaker: u3291
lines.text: The Soviets are in control of the SAMs. It's hard to believe with their centralized command structure that it could be an accidental launch.

lines.speaker: u3292
lines.text: I saw you out there. You want him to call you back, need you.

lines.speaker: u3293
lines.text: No. I'm glad I'm home.

lines.speaker: u3295
lines.text: It's transparent. The press'll be all over it.

lines.speaker: u3293
lines.text: Six months from now, I'm not going to care. Are you? We'll deal with it.

lines.speaker: u3299
lines.text: Captain, force the sub to the surface for inspection.

lines.speaker: u3296
lines.text: Mr. President! We're receiving reports that the ships are stopping!

lines.speaker: u3299
lines.text: Captain, belay that order!  Bob, where's that coming from!

lines.speaker: u3296
lines.text: Just a second, Mr. President.

lines.speaker: u3299
lines.text: Will somebody find out what's going on?!

lines.speaker: u3300
lines.text: Jesus Christ, Larry, what the fu-- Larry. That's not even your name, is it? What's your real name, you fucking scumbag?

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: Don't have one, Carl. I have a number, man. Just like the numbers on those treasury checks. You stole from your own country, Carl. Shame on you.

lines.speaker: u3301
lines.text: They're going to kill me next. That's what I hear. These new Indians are destroying everything. Our people are a quiet people.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: They can lead us to Jimmy. Just let them go. We're tightening the net on him. We know he's on the reservation.

lines.speaker: u3302
lines.text: Ray...

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: Let the press through.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: You take care.

lines.speaker: u3303
lines.text: If you ever need a place to come back to and listen to the trees a little... we'll be here.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3306
lines.text: Wa-shee is like... a dumpling. Like tallow we put in stew. I think he was calling you chubby boy.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: Great.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: Yellow bird... is gonna sing.

lines.speaker: u3307
lines.text: Yellow Bird committed suicide at three o'clock this morning. Some gung-ho agent from D.C. pushed him into a corner. You're playing a losing game. Pull over.

lines.speaker: u3308
lines.text: Keep talking, Yellow Bird...

lines.speaker: u3310
lines.text: All I know... is I did what I did... and I ain't in solitary, gettin' pumped up with downer, gettin' beat to shit. But I tell you what, Suit. Take me back. Cuz I can't take this shit no more.

lines.speaker: u3311
lines.text: Well?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Well what?

lines.speaker: u3311
lines.text: You got your F-14, you got Top Gun, you got your MiGs....You're our new Top Gun instructor...Now what?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Oh...I'll think of something... What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: u3311
lines.text: I live here, remember?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Right on the flight line?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Yes, Sergeant?

lines.speaker: u3312
lines.text: Remember one thing.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Sir?

lines.speaker: u3312
lines.text: Outside of this gate... I...am Top Gun.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Yes sir!

lines.speaker: u3313
lines.text: OKAY... OKAY. BUT IF I LAND THIS THING UPSIDE DOWN. AND I LIVE. I'LL HAVE YOUR BUTT!

lines.speaker: u3316
lines.text: You'll have mine, Cougar. It'll be where your head used to be.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Let me do the talking.

lines.speaker: u3314
lines.text: Oh, no. You did the flying, I'll do the talking!

lines.speaker: u3326
lines.text: Well, I don't know. That depends.

lines.speaker: u3315
lines.text: On what?

lines.speaker: u3326
lines.text: Well, it doesn't just happen, you gotta do something famous.

lines.speaker: u3315
lines.text: Like what?

lines.speaker: u3326
lines.text: Oh...I'll think of something.

lines.speaker: u3316
lines.text: Mav's a great flyer but....

lines.speaker: u3323
lines.text: He's a hell of a flyer. In fact, he's so damn good he might have been picked for Top Gun himself. Except for one thing.  He just can't seem to follow orders!

lines.speaker: u3326
lines.text: I'VE GOT TWO MORE BOGEYS COMING IN AT FOUR O'CLOCK HIGH.

lines.speaker: u3317
lines.text: GOT 'EM.

lines.speaker: u3318
lines.text: I guess I owe you one.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: You don't owe me anything. We're on the same team.

lines.speaker: u3318
lines.text: You saved our lives. You did it!

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: We did it.

lines.speaker: u3318
lines.text: You're a hell of a flyer.  You can be my wingman any time.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: No. You can be mine!

lines.speaker: u3319
lines.text: Figured it out yet?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Figured out what?

lines.speaker: u3319
lines.text: Who is the best.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: u3319
lines.text: Need a hint?

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: I think I can work it out on my own.

lines.speaker: u3319
lines.text: You like to work alone. I've heard that about you.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: I've heard of you, too. You were in 124 with Bargamian.

lines.speaker: u3319
lines.text: And you were with Cougar. He was my roommate in flight school.

lines.speaker: u3320
lines.text: Who's the hell is that?

lines.speaker: u3324
lines.text: Three guesses.

lines.speaker: u3320
lines.text: Well, he's in trouble and he didn't even get here yet.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: How can I go on? I feel so... responsible.

lines.speaker: u3324
lines.text: Kid, the plain fact is...you are. I'm not gonna stand here and blow sunshine up your ass. Technically, they absolved you. You and I know what really happened. You pushed it. You are responsible and you'll always carry that. You know what, I'll carry it too. I should have taken you out of that cockpit. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic... I always try to find something worthwhile in someone's death. It's no trade-off. It's not one for one. What you learned isn't worth his death. It couldn't be. But maybe there is some value in it. I know it's the first thing I've ever seen that's really gotten to you. Now the question is, what will you do with it. If it gets you out of flight status...so you don't kill yourself or anybody else...that's good. That's one good thing. You were an accident waiting to happen.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: You think I shouldn't fly.

lines.speaker: u3324
lines.text: I didn't say that. That's up to you. I think that if you do, if you choose to come back, you'll be a better pilot... a better man.

lines.speaker: u3321
lines.text: Would you take me back? Would they?

lines.speaker: u3324
lines.text: I'll have to think about it. I don't know about them. I do know one thing, We've got a lot invested in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even more than those other guys, Naval Aviation needs a very few, very good men.

lines.speaker: u3340
lines.text: How could you do this?  You're a mutant.

lines.speaker: u3327
lines.text: Hey, I got four kids to feed.

lines.speaker: u3328
lines.text: Don't bother looking.  It's in your skull.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: u3328
lines.text: Never mind.  Wet a towel and wrap it around your head.  That'll muffle the signal.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: How'd you find me?

lines.speaker: u3328
lines.text: I'd advise you to hurry.

lines.speaker: u3329
lines.text: There you go, Mr. Brubaker.  Suite 610 in the East Wing.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: May I use your pen?

lines.speaker: u3330
lines.text: Kill him.

lines.speaker: u3342
lines.text: It's about goddamn time.

lines.speaker: u3331
lines.text: Demure, aggressive, sleazy?  Be honest.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Sleazy...and demure.

lines.speaker: u3331
lines.text: Forty-one A, Ernie.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: What is it?

lines.speaker: u3332
lines.text: It's a symbol.  Of your desire to return to reality. --Inside your dream, you'll fall asleep.

lines.speaker: u3342
lines.text: Pull them out.

lines.speaker: u3333
lines.text: O.K., everybody pull out!

lines.speaker: u3334
lines.text: They found us!  Everybody out!

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Melina!

lines.speaker: u3335
lines.text: You shoulda listened to me, Quaid. I was there to keep you outta trouble.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Harry, you're making a big mistake! You've got me mixed up with somebody else!

lines.speaker: u3335
lines.text: Unh-uh, pal.  You've got yourself mixed up with somebody else.

lines.speaker: u3336
lines.text: Look at this shit.

lines.speaker: u3342
lines.text: What the hell is this?

lines.speaker: u3337
lines.text: The fare is eighteen credits, please.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Quit while you're ahead.

lines.speaker: u3337
lines.text: Thanks for taking Johnnycab.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Then I can pull this trigger, and it won't matter.

lines.speaker: u3338
lines.text: Doug, don't!

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: They'll be here any minute!  They'll kill you all!

lines.speaker: u3339
lines.text: What's he talking about?

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Let me go!

lines.speaker: u3340
lines.text: What's wrong?

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: I just has a terrible thought...What is this is all a dream?

lines.speaker: u3340
lines.text: Then kiss me quick...before you wake up.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: Wait!

lines.speaker: u3343
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: ...Who are you?

lines.speaker: u3343
lines.text: We were buddies in the Agency back on Mars.  You asked me to find you if you disappeared.  So here I am, good-bye.

lines.speaker: u3341
lines.text: What was I doing on Mars?!  Damn!

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: BACK OFF, BURT...!

lines.speaker: u3344
lines.text: Well, who put you two in charge?

lines.speaker: u3345
lines.text: Fine, make the mistakes I did. I think I'll just be playing this hand myself.

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3345
lines.text: She likes <u>both</u> of us.  We both helped her out.

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: You are so full of shit...

lines.speaker: u3345
lines.text: Oh yeah?  Think about this:  She ain't as narrow-minded as you. I'll lay odds she's looking for character in a man.  For my part, I'd be proud to have her.  I'd goddamn worship her.

lines.speaker: u3350
lines.text: We playing cards tonight?

lines.speaker: u3346
lines.text: I think I'm gonna be sitting up with her.

lines.speaker: u3350
lines.text: I'd do the same.  Well, catch you Thursday.

lines.speaker: u3346
lines.text: You bet.

lines.speaker: u3347
lines.text: Val, we're going to have to forget about the truck...

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: Yeah, Heather, we got you.

lines.speaker: u3349
lines.text: Come on.  Get away from it!

lines.speaker: u3348
lines.text: God, what a stink!

lines.speaker: u3351
lines.text: I've got a plan.  You and Val take your truck, get to the mountains. Hike to Bixby.  Get us some help.

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: Those scumsuckers are my radials, Pham!

lines.speaker: u3352
lines.text: It worked!  There they go!

lines.speaker: u3353
lines.text: LET'S DO IT!

lines.speaker: u3354
lines.text: ...Where're we goin'?

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: That-a-boy. Hospital.

lines.speaker: u3354
lines.text: I don' need a hospital... I feel fine.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: Too fine, Badalato. The bad news is, you're gonna live.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: Forensic ballistics isn't an exact science, is it?

lines.speaker: u3355
lines.text: It most certainly is.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: Isn't there a ten to fifteen-percent margin of error?

lines.speaker: u3355
lines.text: Absolutely not. No more than seven percent.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: In other words, seven times out of a hundred, you're wrong!

lines.speaker: u3356
lines.text: Don't hurt him.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: Where's the nearest hospital?

lines.speaker: u3356
lines.text: Bellevue. Straight up First --

lines.speaker: u3366
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3357
lines.text: No? Then what did he say?

lines.speaker: u3362
lines.text: It's okay. It was always like that.

lines.speaker: u3367
lines.text: Shouldn't one of us...?

lines.speaker: u3362
lines.text: No -- leave him be. It's better for everyone.

lines.speaker: u3363
lines.text: Look. Mister --

lines.speaker: u3367
lines.text: -- Roger --

lines.speaker: u3363
lines.text: You mustn't talk to Art. You mustn't tell Art that I was at the trial. Do you hear me?

lines.speaker: u3366
lines.text: Mr. Ortega, what is Shu Kai Kim's rank within La Compania?

lines.speaker: u3365
lines.text: Soldado.

lines.speaker: u3366
lines.text: Isn't it unusual for an Asian to be accepted into a Cuban prison gang?

lines.speaker: u3365
lines.text: Shu's the only one I know of...

lines.speaker: u3366
lines.text: And why was an exception made?

lines.speaker: u3365
lines.text: Chinatown. Sounded pretty cold...

lines.speaker: u3366
lines.text: You mean to say Mr. Kim told you that he murdered Jimmy Chin?

lines.speaker: u3367
lines.text: CIA?

lines.speaker: u3370
lines.text: Telephone.  I suppose you don't know the phone company killed Kennedy because he was trying to b-break it up -- and they'll never let that happen. They control everything: what you say in the mouthpiece is never exactly what comes out the other end, and --

lines.speaker: u3367
lines.text: The phone company was broken up.

lines.speaker: u3370
lines.text: And you b-believe that.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: Cooper, the ooze of mumbo jumbo is rising up above our heads. Do you honestly think Cole's practice of word association works?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: The very fact that we are talking about word association means we are in a space that was opened up by our practice of word association. The world is a hologram, Albert.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: Yes, it's a great big psychedelic circus ride, isn't it, Cooper?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: Albert.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: You said, "Teresa Banks", so you think something is going on somewhere in the world right now that is connected with her murder?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: Yes. Either right now or right when I thought of it. The name and memory of Teresa Banks is haunting me. Lately I have been filled with a knowingness that the murderer will strike again. Because it is only a feeling, I am powerless to stop it. And another thing, Albert, when the next murder happens you will help me solve it.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: Let's test it for the record. Will the next victim be a man or a woman?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: A woman.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: What color hair will she have?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: Blonde.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: Tell me some other things about her.

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: She's in high school. She's sexually active. She's on drugs. She's crying out for some help.

lines.speaker: u3371
lines.text: You're describing half the high school girls in America.  What is she doing right now?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: She is preparing a great abundance of food.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3372
lines.text: I want you to kill for me.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: No. Never. You'll have to kill me.

lines.speaker: u3372
lines.text: I want you to kill for me.

lines.speaker: u3373
lines.text: Bobby's got it.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Thanks, Bobby.  And my little round friends, too.

lines.text: We're taking the body back to Portland and there's not a thing you can do about it.

lines.speaker: u3374
lines.text: Maybe not a thing, but maybe two things.
