lines.text: Teresa Banks had a ring. Any idea what happened to it?

lines.speaker: u3374
lines.text: We got a phone, here, that's got a little ring.

lines.speaker: u3379
lines.text: Sam, get the body and put it in the van.  Sheriff Cable, where were you the night Teresa Banks was murdered?

lines.speaker: u3374
lines.text: My alibi is as strong as these bands of steel.

lines.speaker: u3379
lines.text: Thanks for your help, Carl. Sorry we woke you up.

lines.speaker: u3375
lines.text: That's alright. I was having a bad dream. I was dreamin' about a joke with no punchline.

lines.speaker: u3376
lines.text: You try that you little monkey.

lines.speaker: u3379
lines.text: I think I'll take off my badge as well.

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: It was a year ago today that Teresa Banks was killed. I'm wondering if the murderer will ever kill again.

lines.speaker: u3377
lines.text: ALBERT, WHY TYLENOL?

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: Where is the ring?

lines.speaker: u3393
lines.text: Someone else has it now.

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: That would indicate that it's the future.

lines.speaker: u3393
lines.text: The later events have never been kept a secret.

lines.speaker: u3378
lines.text: Where am I? And how can I leave?

lines.speaker: u3393
lines.text: You are here and there is no place to go...

lines.speaker: u3398
lines.text: One thing that has been troubling me. That lamp at the diner. Do you think they were working on it for esthetic reasons or was their work due to faulty wiring?

lines.speaker: u3379
lines.text: Faulty wiring.

lines.speaker: u3398
lines.text: Esthetics are subjective, aren't they, Agent Desmond?  I'm Sam Stanley. If you ever need me.

lines.speaker: u3379
lines.text: Thanks, Sam, for the good work. You have a good eye for detail.

lines.speaker: u3398
lines.text: We do notice things, don't we, Agent Desmond? Are you going back to the trailer park for the Blue rose?

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: I can't remember anything about last night. Is there something I should remember?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: No, you should forget about last night.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: Laura, I am your friend.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I know you are and you don't have to do anything crazy to prove it.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: You're not mad at me?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: I feel so bad. I had nightmares all night long.  They all knew you at that place.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: What can I tell you?

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: How did the car get back here?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: WE got it back, that's all.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: How did I get in the house? How did I get into my bed?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I can't help you there.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: Was I wearing something of yours and you got mad at me?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: All my things have me in them. I don't want you to be like me.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: But I love you, Laura.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: And I love you, too. But don't wear my stuff.

lines.speaker: u3380
lines.text: Why do you do it, Laura?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Cause I like it.

lines.speaker: u3395
lines.text: Even this heavy work beats being at home with the old ball and chain.

lines.speaker: u3381
lines.text: Brother, I hear you talkin'.

lines.speaker: u3382
lines.text: What about James? Can't James help you? You two are so in love.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: He's in love with a girl who's dead.  It is dangerous for you to have it. I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u3382
lines.text: I'm so sorry, Laura.

lines.speaker: u3385
lines.text: Laura, you didn't come and see me today.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I couldn't it was Johnny Horne's birthday. I promised I'd be with him. I told you not to call me here.

lines.speaker: u3385
lines.text: A little trouble with your parents is the least of your worries and something I am certainly willing to put up with.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I'm not.

lines.speaker: u3385
lines.text: Did you make me a tape?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I already made you two tapes.

lines.speaker: u3385
lines.text: Laura, you have to deal with all of this.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: I'm dealing with it, Doc. Big time. Maybe I'll make you a tape tomorrow. Goodnight.

lines.speaker: u3385
lines.text: Send me a kiss.

lines.speaker: u3386
lines.text: Right on time, baby.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Buy me a ticket to The Great Went.

lines.speaker: u3386
lines.text: We're on our way, Baby.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Let's go all the way.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Shit, maybe he'll kill you.

lines.speaker: u3387
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: When he finds out.

lines.speaker: u3387
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Bobby killed a guy.

lines.speaker: u3387
lines.text: What are you talking about? Bobby didn't kill anybody.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: You want to see...

lines.speaker: u3387
lines.text: See what?

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: Right. Open your eyes, James. You don't know me. Even Donna doesn't know me. Your Laura disappeared... It's just me now.

lines.speaker: u3388
lines.text: History is on our side, Ben. It's no accident that the great explorers were named Hennepin, Nicollet, Marquette.

lines.speaker: u3391
lines.text: They were looking for wood.

lines.speaker: u3400
lines.text: I'm not saying it's right or wrong, it's just the way I feel. It's the custom thing I was thinking of. In America we don't use any part of the fish but the meat just to the side of the insides. We throw away the tail, the rest of the insides and the head.

lines.speaker: u3389
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: u3400
lines.text: We throw away the whole head.

lines.speaker: u3391
lines.text: DON'T MAKE ME DO IT.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: NO, YOU HAVE TO KILL ME.

lines.speaker: u3391
lines.text: I always thought you knew it was me.

lines.speaker: u3390
lines.text: NO! YOU CAN'T HAVE ME.  KILL ME.

lines.speaker: u3399
lines.text: What's wrong?

lines.speaker: u3391
lines.text: Nothing, I chickened out.

lines.speaker: u3392
lines.text: That's one thing you are going to learn, Shelly, -- HOW TO CLEAN. It takes scrubbing, Shelly. There is no easy way. THIS IS WHERE WE LIVE, SHELLY.

lines.speaker: u3397
lines.text: As if I didn't know.

lines.speaker: u3392
lines.text: I'm going to show you how to wash this tile and then you're going to do it.

lines.speaker: u3397
lines.text: Come off it, Leo. I'm late for work...

lines.speaker: u3392
lines.text: What did you say?

lines.speaker: u3394
lines.text: Come back as soon as you can.

lines.speaker: u3397
lines.text: If Leo comes here, he won't believe that I am out doing the "Meals on Wheels".

lines.speaker: u3394
lines.text: Don't worry, Shelly, I'll handle Leo.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Mr. Abraham...

lines.speaker: u3401
lines.text: Abrams...

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Abrams. Yes. How are you today?

lines.speaker: u3401
lines.text: I'm fine.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Good.  You ever been inside a hospital?

lines.speaker: u3401
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Ah. How did they treat you?

lines.speaker: u3403
lines.text: If we were to go to trial, would we win the case?

lines.speaker: u3402
lines.text: Well, of course, it's always dangerous...

lines.speaker: u3403
lines.text: I know that answer. If we went to trial would we win?

lines.speaker: u3402
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3403
lines.text: Nothing that we can do can make that woman well.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: And no one will know the truth.

lines.speaker: u3403
lines.text: What is the truth?

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: That that poor girl put her trust in the hands of two men who took her life, she's in a coma, her life is gone. She has no family, she has no home, she's tied to a machine, she has no friends -- and the people who should care for her: her Doctors, and you, and me, have been bought off to look the other way. We have been paid to look the other way. I came in here to take your money.  I brought snapshots to show you. So I could get your money.  I can't take it. If I take it. If I take that money I'm lost. I'm just going to be a rich ambulance chaser.  I can't do it. I can't take it.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: That's the call that I'm waiting for.

lines.speaker: u3404
lines.text: What does it mean?

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: They want to settle.  It means a lot of money.

lines.speaker: u3404
lines.text: Does that mean I'm back for awhile?

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: ...and her heart stopped and she wasn't getting oxygen.

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: That's right.

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: And what did your team do...

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: Well, we...

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: ...You brought thirty years of medical experience to bear. Isn't that what you did?

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: ...A patient riddled with complications, questionable information on her, on her admitting form...

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: ...We did everything we could...

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: ...to save her and to save the baby. Is that...

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: You reached down into death. Now, isn't that right?

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: My God, we tried to save her... You can't know... You can't know...

lines.speaker: u3405
lines.text: Tell us.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: If I could accept the offer right now, I would.  They took it back.

lines.speaker: u3406
lines.text: I understand.  I went to the Bar Association. They tell me you're going to be disbarred.

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: She getting good care over there?

lines.speaker: u3407
lines.text: Actually, yes. It's by no means bad, I...

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: Then what good would it do to ruin the reputation of two men, to help a girl whose life's not going to be changed in the least? You know what CODE BLUE means?

lines.speaker: u3407
lines.text: 'Code Blue'...

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: It's a common medical term.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: 'Practice and Methodology in Anaesthesia.' General textbook on the subject. Is that correct?

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: I. Yes. It is.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: And you wrote that...

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: ...Page 414, 'If a patient has taken nourishment within one hour prior to inducement, general anesthetic should be avoided at all costs because of the grave risk the patient will aspirate food particles into his mask.' Is that what happened to Deborah Ann Kaye? She aspirated into her mask?

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: She threw up in her mask, yes. But she hadn't eaten one hour prior to admission.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: If she had eaten, say one hour prior to admission, the inducement of a general anesthetic... the type you gave her... would have been negligent...?

lines.speaker: u3408
lines.text: Negligent. Yes... it would have been criminal. But that was not the case.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u3420
lines.text: Brain damage could have been... it didn't necessarily take nine minutes, it could have been caused in two...

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait, you're saying that her brain damage could have been caused by her being deprived of oxygen for two minutes...?

lines.speaker: u3420
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3409
lines.text: Huh. And why is that?

lines.speaker: u3420
lines.text: Because she was anemic.  It's right there on her chart. Her brain was getting less oxygen anyway...

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: Stearns, Harrington, you know who that is?

lines.speaker: u3414
lines.text: Should I?

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: A huge law firm. Okay? They put him in the firm, he's married, everything's superb. Franky, he's starting to talk like he comes from Dorsetshire, some fuckin' place, 'You must drop by with Pat and me...' Okay...?

lines.speaker: u3414
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: ...and he's making a billion dollars every minute working for Stearns, Harrington, and he bought a dog, and everything is rosy.  Then Mr. Stearns, he tried to fix a case.

lines.speaker: u3414
lines.text: The Big Boy did...?

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: That Frank was working on. Yeah. He thought Franky needed some help, so they bribed a juror. So Franky finds out. He comes to me in tears. He thinks that anybody who knows what a 'spinnaker' is got to be a saint. I told him 'Franky, wake up. These people are sharks. What do you think they got so rich from? Doing good?' He can't be comforted. He tells the boys at Stearns and Harrington they've disappointed him, he's going to the Judge to rat them out.

lines.speaker: u3414
lines.text: Huh.

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: Before he can get there here comes this Federal Marshal, and Franky's indicted for Jury tampering, they throw him in jail, he's gonna be disbarred, his life is over.  Jimmy, gimme another drink.  How are you?

lines.speaker: u3414
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.speaker: u3417
lines.text: Okay. Now, so he's in jail. He, finally, he gets to see the light, he calls up Harrington, he says he thinks he made a mistake. As if by magic, charges against him are dropped, he's released from jail.  P.S. He's fired from the firm, his wife divorces him, he turns to drink and mopes around three and a half years.  You like that story?

lines.speaker: u3438
lines.text: Hey, there - open up!

lines.speaker: u3423
lines.text: Come on out!  We're friends!

lines.speaker: u3435
lines.text: There's only one thing that will stop the Martians!  We've held back pre- viously because of the danger of radiation to civilians.  Now there's no choice.  The United Nations has voted authority to the United States.  The White House will confirm an order to use the Atom bomb.

lines.speaker: u3424
lines.text: Then our first target will be the initial landing place outside Los Angeles.

lines.speaker: u3435
lines.text: I'll request the scientists from Pacific-Tech to monitor the drop.  We'll clear the area all around.  After that we'll hit them all over the world. I'll have long-range bombers alerted, loaded and standing by.

lines.speaker: u3427
lines.text: It's about that meteor.  They say it's a whopper.  The District Officer phoned us at the lookout up on the summit. Thought you might be interested... It's ten or twelve miles from here - over by Linda Rosa.

lines.speaker: u3425
lines.text: Are they sure it's a meteor?  It didn't come down like one.

lines.speaker: u3427
lines.text: That's right - came down in kinda spurts, didn't it?  You fellers'll have to figure it out.  You're scientists  All I know - they say it's as big as a house and practically red hot.

lines.speaker: u3425
lines.text: I'd like to borrow your car and take a look at it in the morning.

lines.speaker: u3426
lines.text: My orders are not to go into action unless they make a move out of there.

lines.speaker: u3428
lines.text: That's because we want a chance to observe them.  This is the only place we've had time to surround them with sufficient force to contain them.  What happens here will be a guide to all other operations. The minute action begins and a pattern of defense develops, I'll get my report to Washington.  You've deployed your forces well.

lines.speaker: u3426
lines.text: Thank you, sir.  If they start anything, we can blast them right off the earth!

lines.speaker: u3428
lines.text: They'll probably move at dawn.

lines.speaker: u3437
lines.text: Let's go back inside, Uncle Matthew.

lines.speaker: u3431
lines.text: I've done about all I can do here. You go back in.  Sylvia - I like that Doctor Forrester.  He's a good man.

lines.speaker: u3433
lines.text: Number three to. D.O....Number three to D.O.

lines.speaker: u3432
lines.text: D.O. to number three..come in.

lines.speaker: u3433
lines.text: We're getting this under control. Won't need any more help.  Over.

lines.speaker: u3432
lines.text: Okay.  Send the tanker in, but you stand by until that thing cools off. Over.

lines.speaker: u3433
lines.text: I think somebody ought to check on it. Over.

lines.speaker: u3432
lines.text: Well, there's some fellows fishing at Pine Summit might be interested.  They probably saw it come down.  I'll let 'em know...What's it look like?

lines.speaker: u3438
lines.text: They'll understand us, all right!

lines.speaker: u3434
lines.text: Sure, sure!  Everybody understands you wave the white flag, you wanna be friends.

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Bob, how long has Wes been working on this script?

lines.speaker: u3439
lines.text: I don't know.  A couple months.  Why?

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: And since you've been thinking of making it.  Has anything funny happened?

lines.speaker: u3439
lines.text: I don't follow.

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Like weird calls, by any chance?

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3440
lines.text: I'll be there in three hours.

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Don't speed, Chase.  It's not...

lines.speaker: u3441
lines.text: No way he's going anywhere.  He's been well sedated.

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: He doesn't have to be awake to be on his feet.

lines.speaker: u3441
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: He sleepwalks, you idiot!  He's fully capable of walking out of this hospital.  Oh my God...He thinks I've gone home...

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Yes.  It's a story.  A story for a movie.

lines.speaker: u3442
lines.text: Read me some?

lines.speaker: u3450
lines.text: Can I get you something to drink?

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Coffee'd be nice.

lines.speaker: u3450
lines.text: Sounds good.  Kim, would you get Heather and me a coffee?  How you like it, Hon?

lines.speaker: u3443
lines.text: Black's fine.

lines.speaker: u3450
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: u3452
lines.text: What are they doing?

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Claiming their place in the world.

lines.speaker: u3465
lines.text: So to all you sailors who've fought wind and whale...

lines.speaker: u3453
lines.text: Weight!  Hey!  Blow the man down...

lines.speaker: u3465
lines.text: She said "None the better, you all go to hell..."

lines.speaker: u3453
lines.text: Give me some time to Blow the man down!

lines.speaker: u3470
lines.text: There's still a way.

lines.speaker: u3454
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: u3470
lines.text: It's me, don't you see.  Terry's right, I'm the escape hatch.  I disobeyed order.

lines.speaker: u3456
lines.text: When we were growing up I always felt like you would take care of things, that everything would be okay.  But you can't make this okay, can you?

lines.speaker: u3455
lines.text: No, I can't.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Does Phil know how you guys feel?

lines.speaker: u3456
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: You should tell him.  That's something he can take with him.

lines.speaker: u3457
lines.text: Stow away?

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: He left his passport in Curacao. It's being mailed to Panama.

lines.speaker: u3457
lines.text: That is unfortunate.  We'll have to take him with us.

lines.speaker: u3458
lines.text: So when the captain gave you an order contrary to your training, you thought he was making a mistake?

lines.speaker: u3470
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3459
lines.text: Who is it Philip?

lines.speaker: u3464
lines.text: It's okay.  I'll be in, in a minute.  Look, what do you want?

lines.speaker: u3460
lines.text: They think we're carrying Cuban refugees.  Skipper, they mean to board us.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Not a chance.  Remind them that according to the Geneva Convention, firing on a civilian vessel on the high sea is an act of war.

lines.speaker: u3462
lines.text: The rust won't wait for you to read Conrad, Goodall.

lines.speaker: u3461
lines.text: Then he shouldn't have written such a long poem, Mr. Lawford.

lines.speaker: u3462
lines.text: Read on, young John.  Read on. College boards are coming.

lines.speaker: u3462
lines.text: If he's a Cuban, Castro wears a dress.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Nobody aboard my ship is going anywhere.

lines.speaker: u3464
lines.text: I'm not gonna kill it.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: You already have.  Now go on.  Do it.

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Are you hating this?!  Are you!

lines.speaker: u3466
lines.text: I hate you, you son of a bitch!!!

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: No.  Hate the fear inside of you! Climb like a man mister!  Hate it! Hate it away.  Hate your way up one more rung!!  Do it right now!!

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3467
lines.text: Isn't also true that his vessel went down off of Nantucket?  Lost everyone on board.  In fair weather no less.

lines.speaker: u3471
lines.text: If this young man had responded instantly to your command, do you believe the ship might have been spared?

lines.speaker: u3468
lines.text: I don't know that anything could have prevented what happened.

lines.speaker: u3471
lines.text: Then what are you trying to say then?

lines.speaker: u3469
lines.text: Easy for you to say.

lines.speaker: u3470
lines.text: What's that supposed to mean?!

lines.speaker: u3469
lines.text: Everybody knows why she went over Tod.  You jibed the boat.

lines.speaker: u3470
lines.text: I was trying to get her up wind! That's what you do when you're hit a-beam.  Or maybe you're too stupid to know that!

lines.speaker: u3469
lines.text: That's not what Skipper thought.  He was trying to spill air from the main!

lines.speaker: u3473
lines.text: Come in, Montgomery, Alabama.

lines.speaker: u3478
lines.text: Artie? That you, Artie?

lines.speaker: u3473
lines.text: Yes, ma'am. What's on your almost- perfect mind this evening?

lines.speaker: u3478
lines.text: How ya feelin', Artie? I heard you wasn't doin' too well recent.

lines.speaker: u3473
lines.text: I'm fine, thank you. I had a cardiac infarction but I'm on a new diet and exercising regularly. I've never felt better.

lines.speaker: u3478
lines.text: Well, that's so good to hear, Artie. You know some of us depend on you down this way. You're so entertainin' and you get so many interestin' guests.

lines.speaker: u3473
lines.text: Thank you. It's listeners such as yourself who made me want to get up out of that hospital bed and back into the studio as fast as I could.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Meetin' him at the gate. That phone call this afternoon was the signal. My deranged mama's hid the keys to my car. But of course, I know exactly where they are.

lines.speaker: u3474
lines.text: I didn't hate me so much, I'd feel better wishin' you luck.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Can't all husbands be perfect, and your Elmo prob'ly wouldn'ta ever got that second one pregnant, you hadn't kicked his ass out.

lines.speaker: u3474
lines.text: So you're gonna be needin' the "blue- bird" pretty soon?

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Real soon... I'll be makin' the swap tomorrow, and thanks again, Beany.

lines.speaker: u3475
lines.text: I'd just soon have a paper bag rather than a plastic one, if it's same to you.

lines.speaker: u3481
lines.text: We don't have no paper bags.

lines.speaker: u3476
lines.text: That's right... Could have a bad accident, though... before... durin'... or after a hold-up...

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: What's gonna happen when he sees me drivin' the car tomorrow?

lines.speaker: u3476
lines.text: Maybe he'll get a little nervous, but who gives a shit?

lines.speaker: u3477
lines.text: Mostly black though in that boogie place.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: What's the name of it?

lines.speaker: u3477
lines.text: Club Zanzibar.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: You say it's straight ahead a mile?

lines.speaker: u3477
lines.text: About. Where Lafitte crosses over Galvez Highway. State Road 86.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u3479
lines.text: So who you out sleuthin' for now?... Can I help ya?

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: Actually, I'm lookin' for Marietta's daughter, Lula. Her and 'er beau took off the other day. Marietta's real upset about it.

lines.speaker: u3479
lines.text: Hell, that rings a bell. Someone told me somebody lookin' like her was at the Nothin' Fancy yesterday.

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: Sounds right... I'll check it out.

lines.speaker: u3479
lines.text: You hitched yet?

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: No sir...

lines.speaker: u3479
lines.text: It's none of my business, but when are you and Marietta gonna tie the knot? I always wondered why you never did.

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: Not for lack of love, I can tell ya that.

lines.speaker: u3479
lines.text: That's what I mean... Always looked like you was just knocked out in love... Was real nice to see.

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: I'll tell ya though, it's comin' up to the time when Marietta and me might just set up house together and settle down... I think that time's comin' up right soon. But like you said, everythin's relative.

lines.speaker: u3480
lines.text: He wants to take Mr. San Pedro Sula and me bass fishing.

lines.speaker: u3491
lines.text: We are in the same businesses and also we are fishermen.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: If your neighbors didn't mind, how'd you get put out of business?

lines.speaker: u3482
lines.text: Woman drivin' down the street spotted me with on a roof with my rifle. She called the police and they came over and arrested me. Thought I was a sniper! Boys at the VFW loved that one. Cops didn't understand about the pigeons, the damage they do to personal property. I used to complain to the city but they never lifted a finger. I was gonna put out poison, but I was afraid somebody's cat would eat it. Hell, I had six cats myself. So I used the .22 because it didn't make much noise and the ammo was cheap.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: What happened on the charges?

lines.speaker: u3482
lines.text: Guilty on a reduced charge. Hundred dollar fine and ordered to desist. Pigeons carry diseases and muss up the place. You seen it. Plain filth.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: The Good Witch...

lines.speaker: u3483
lines.text: Sailor... Lula loves you.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: But I'm a robber and a manslaughterer and I haven't had any parental guidance.

lines.speaker: u3483
lines.text: She's forgiven you of all these things... You love her... Don't be afraid, Sailor.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: But I'm wild at heart.

lines.speaker: u3483
lines.text: If you are truly wild at heart, you'll fight for your dreams... Don't turn away from love, Sailor... Don't turn away from love... Don't turn away from love.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: I'm sorry to do this to ya here in front of a crowd, but I want ya to stand up and make a nice apology to my girl.

lines.speaker: u3484
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: I'll pack my things and meet you downstairs.

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: And to think what coulda happened in that king-sized bed tonight...

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: You won't of missed much.

lines.speaker: u3485
lines.text: See ya downstairs.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: I'm goin', mama. No way I can't go.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: You ain't takin' Pace, though.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Course I am, mama.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: What time's Sailor's train get in?

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Six.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Got any plans?

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Figure we'll go have supper someplace. Maybe get some barbecue out by Stateline. Sailor always liked that Havana Brown's Pig Pickin'.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Well, you be careful with that boy, Lula.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Sailor ain't a boy no more, mama.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Don't mean him. It's Pace concerns me.

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Really, mama, I gotta go.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: What if I asked you not to?

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Wouldn't make any difference.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: What if I told you not to?

lines.speaker: u3486
lines.text: Mama... if you get in the way of me and Sailor's happiness, I'll fuckin' pull your arms out by the roots.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Oh God! What does that mean?

lines.speaker: u3487
lines.text: I'm sure I wouldn't know, ma'am... and buffalo hunting too... hmmmmm?

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: And jus when my baby's out on some Texas road with a killer.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: No... I just wanted to kiss you good- bye... You know too much 'bout little Lula's mom...

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Whattya mean?

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Well, Johnnie told me you used to drive for Clyde and Santos...

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: So?

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: So maybe one night you got a little too close to the fire... And you're gonna get burned, baby... And besides that, you're shit... D'you think I'd let my little girl go with shit like you?... Why, you belong right here in one of these toilets.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: You're gonna have to kill me to keep me away from Lula.

lines.speaker: u3488
lines.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout that...

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: It's a prob'lm I don't think's gonna go away too soon though... Peanut, I'm thinkin' of breakin' parole and takin' you out to sunny California.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: Oh... Look at this... What do you want, snakeskin?

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Just passin' through on my way to who knows where...

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: Sure... I figured I'd see you sometime...

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Hopin' you could tell me if there's a contract out on me. I really need to know.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: By who?

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: I think Santos or Marietta Fortune.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: Heard you was goin' out with that bitch's daughter.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: You heard right.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: You really are one dumb asshole.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Life is unpredictable.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: Does that girlfriend of yours know that her mama and Santos killed her daddy?  Does she know her own daddy was one of the biggest drug dealers around - till he started snortin' the shit himself?...  Does she know you was around that night her daddy was set fire to?

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: I didn't see nothin'...

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: Yeah... But I did... And I told you all about it...

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Is there a contract?... We made a deal once that we'd tip each other off if we ever heard.

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: I know... I remember.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Well?...

lines.speaker: u3490
lines.text: I ain't heard of nothin'.

lines.speaker: u3493
lines.text: Thanks...

lines.speaker: u3497
lines.text: You peeked, didn't you?

lines.speaker: u3495
lines.text: I peeked.

lines.speaker: u3496
lines.text: I'll be... somewhere else.

lines.speaker: u3497
lines.text: Hey, Jeff. If you're really interested in discussing that business with the tango, try the guy at the end of the hall.

lines.speaker: u3503
lines.text: One other thing. About this kid, this student of yours -- Leer -- James Leer. You wouldn't know how I could get in touch with him, would you?

lines.speaker: u3497
lines.text: I might have his number on campus.

lines.speaker: u3503
lines.text: That's all right. We'll find him.

lines.speaker: u3501
lines.text: Pier Angeli, 1971 or '72, also pills. Charles Boyer, 1978, pills again. Charles Butterworth, 1946, I think. In a car. Supposedly it was an accident, but, you know...  He was distraught. Dorothy Dandridge, she took pills in, like, 1965. Albert Dekker, 1968, he hung himself. He wrote his suicide note in lipstick on his stomach. Alan Ladd, '64, more pills, Carole Landis, pills again, I forget when. George Reeves, Superman on TV, shot himself. Jean Seberg, pills of course, 1979. Everett Sioane -- he was good -- pills. Margaret Sullavan, pills, Lupe Velez, a lot of pills. Gig Young. He shot himself and his wife in 1978. There are more but I don't know if you would have heard of them. Ross Alexander? Clara Blandick? Maggie McNamara? Gia Scaia?

lines.speaker: u3500
lines.text: I haven't heard of half of those.

lines.speaker: u3509
lines.text: I could swear I had a '63 Chateau Latour in here. You haven't seen it, have you?

lines.speaker: u3504
lines.text: I doubt I'd recognize a '63 Chateau Latour if I was sitting on it.

lines.speaker: u3509
lines.text: You'd recognize it if you tasted it.

lines.speaker: u3504
lines.text: I doubt it, darling.

lines.speaker: u3509
lines.text: Well, Q certainly will. And, given that he will be addressing 500 people in little over an hour...

lines.speaker: u3504
lines.text: You want to keep him happy.

lines.speaker: u3509
lines.text: If he's happy...  I'm happy.

lines.speaker: u3511
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: I mean... feelings.

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: You tell me your name, I'll tell you mine.

lines.speaker: u3512
lines.text: Robin.

lines.speaker: u3513
lines.text: You sure you don't know nothing about this?

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: 'Fraid not.

lines.speaker: u3514
lines.text: Sergeant Lucas.  May I come in?

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: You are in.

lines.speaker: u3515
lines.text: People have the right to know.

lines.speaker: u3518
lines.text: If she's here tomorrow, I'll fucking kill her.

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u3516
lines.text: I don't mind.

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: You should go home.

lines.speaker: u3516
lines.text: Can't I stay a little longer?

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: It's getting dark. Go home.

lines.speaker: u3516
lines.text: Will I see you again?

lines.speaker: u3517
lines.text: It's going to take time, Walter.

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: Time.

lines.speaker: u3517
lines.text: How do you feel about that?

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: I feel... okay.

lines.speaker: u3519
lines.text: I heard they were filthy birds.

lines.speaker: u3518
lines.text: Not when they fly.

lines.speaker: u3520
lines.text: Hafta... go on to... the moonpool.  Only way.

lines.speaker: u3521
lines.text: I can't... make it... podner.

lines.speaker: u3523
lines.text: SHIT!

lines.speaker: u3521
lines.text: Give me that!!

lines.speaker: u3525
lines.text: You've got some huevos bringing this... thing... into my rig!  With everything that's been going on up in the world, you bring a nuclear weapon in here?  Does this strike anyone as particularly psychotic, or is it just me?

lines.speaker: u3522
lines.text: You don't need to know the details of this mission... you're better off if you don't.

lines.speaker: u3525
lines.text: You're right... I don't.  I just need to know that this thing is out of here!  You hear me, Roger Ramjet?

lines.speaker: u3522
lines.text: Mrs. Brigman, you're becoming a serious impediment to this mission.  I believe the stress is affecting you.  Escort her to quarters and have Monk prepare a tranquilizer.

lines.speaker: u3523
lines.text: You boss is having a full-on meltdown.  Guy's fixing to pull the pin on fifty kilotons and we're all ringside!

lines.speaker: u3526
lines.text: What's the timer set for?

lines.speaker: u3525
lines.text: Would we see the flash?

lines.speaker: u3526
lines.text: Through three miles of water?   I don't know.

lines.speaker: u3529
lines.text: Up until now, Dad, I've been the one who hasn't wanted to marry him.

lines.speaker: u3535
lines.text: It's the same thing. Goodbye, dear.

lines.speaker: u3530
lines.text: This looks to me like a good sign. Don't you think so? As far as I'm concerned, anyone who reads the Bible could not have committed an act of impropriety. Why... as a matter of fact, I remember when I was in China, many years ago, I happened to be involved in a similar situation, concerning an English woman, the wife of Ambassador Shafford, a good friend of mine. There, too, we found a Bible... And I said at the time that whatever had happened, that clue alone had definitely ruled out the possibility of... suicide. Why, it was logical, I said, that whoever reads the Bible believes in God and therefore...  No? You don't believe it? Well, as a matter of fact, I was right... The woman was found two days later. It was a case of amnesia.

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: Sir, if you have no objections, may we start the search?

lines.speaker: u3531
lines.text: These people are contemptible. They have no sense of dignity at all.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: And you say that came from Lisca Bianca?

lines.speaker: u3531
lines.text: It couldn't have come from anywhere else. At least, somewhere from that vicinity... But I really can't understand it. Contraband cigarettes on that island! It's the first time that ever happened.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Look... I'd like to get back to Lisca Bianca.

lines.speaker: u3531
lines.text: But how could we...at a time like this when we just... well, let's at least first have a look around the other islands. Could be that something might turn up there.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: But even here we were supposed to find who knows what... And all we bring back with us is a crate of cigarettes.

lines.speaker: u3531
lines.text: As you wish.

lines.speaker: u3536
lines.text: Now what do I have to do to be left in peace?

lines.speaker: u3532
lines.text: I think all you have to do, Giulia, is to close the door.

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: Up until now those smugglers were operating only around the Palermo area. This will be a nice surprise for the Lieutenant in Milazzo... Call up headquarters. Bring them up to date and have them give you instructions on what to do with this crate.

lines.speaker: u3533
lines.text: So... the boat we saw yesterday afternoon might have also been that of these smugglers. Could it be possible, then, that Anna...?

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: I wonder where they could have unloaded the stuff ... Maybe right here at Lisca.

lines.speaker: u3533
lines.text: I was saying... it might even be possible that Anna had left with them.

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: But for what reason would she have wanted to go away?

lines.speaker: u3533
lines.text: Listen, Marshal... As for there being reasons for going away, anyone of us might have three thousand of them. So you can assume that she had them. What I want to know, is it possible that the smugglers might have taken her aboard?

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: I think it's possible.

lines.speaker: u3543
lines.text: Ettore...

lines.speaker: u3534
lines.text: What is it?

lines.speaker: u3543
lines.text: Nothing, nothing  at all. I was just looking for Sandro.

lines.speaker: u3534
lines.text: And you expect to find him in here? Go and ask Claudia.

lines.speaker: u3543
lines.text: Yes, yes, of course.

lines.speaker: u3536
lines.text: Don't you ever paint men?

lines.speaker: u3537
lines.text: Answer me, why don't you try posing? I'll paint you a beautiful portrait.

lines.speaker: u3536
lines.text: But why me?... Ask Claudia, she's much more beautiful than me.

lines.speaker: u3537
lines.text: But I want to paint you. You appeal to me more.

lines.speaker: u3536
lines.text: I appeal to you more?

lines.speaker: u3547
lines.text: Yes, sir. Three times.

lines.speaker: u3538
lines.text: Now, we're getting somewhere! They're beginning to contradict each other.  Now look here, your friend just swore to me that you weren't able to do any fishing at all because the sea was too rough... And what about the other boat?

lines.speaker: u3547
lines.text: What other boat?

lines.speaker: u3538
lines.text: Now look, my men saw it and they also saw you men throwing those crates overboard. What have you got to say about that?

lines.speaker: u3547
lines.text: I ... I ... wasn't feeling well ... I.. I was sleeping... I don't know anything ... I ... I'm all mixed up and ...

lines.speaker: u3546
lines.text: Music, of course. To get a sweetheart, one has to look around, but to get a radio, all you have to do is buy one.

lines.speaker: u3539
lines.text: Ah, no... For me, love comes first. I'm a man, and I know what's what: first love, and then music.

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: Anything new develop?

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Unfortunately, no.

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: Very well. First of all, I'll have them search the waters around the island. I brought two frogmen with me... Meanwhile, we'll take a look up around here.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Look, Marshal, with those deep crevasses, you'll need some rope and ladders...

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: Don't worry, we've got everything.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Another thing; there's an old man who lives here on the island...

lines.speaker: u3540
lines.text: I know, I know. One thing at a time.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Then you should also be able to tell me where a young girl might stay in Noto; are there any hotels or rooming houses?

lines.speaker: u3541
lines.text: There's the Trinacria Hotel... or the Regina, near the municipal building. As for rooming houses, I don't know...

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u3541
lines.text: Don't mention it... Pleased to be of service any time.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Whose boat is that?

lines.speaker: u3542
lines.text: What boat?

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Just a moment ago... didn't you hear the sound of a motor?

lines.speaker: u3542
lines.text: At this time of the year there are so many boats...

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: And how come you're up so early?

lines.speaker: u3542
lines.text: Early? Is four in the morning early for you?

lines.speaker: u3544
lines.text: Here I am, Patrizia. I'm always here.

lines.speaker: u3543
lines.text: Claudia isn't coming with us. Will you please take care of her luggage? Thanks.

lines.speaker: u3548
lines.text: As a matter of fact, I've already had several phone calls on that article. One said they had seen the missing girl in an automobile somewhere in Rome. Another one said they saw her on the pier talking with some strange sailors... Could be she secretly left the island by boat...

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Is that possible?

lines.speaker: u3548
lines.text: Who knows?... Another one has it that she entered a store in Troina. This information comes from the storekeeper himself who stated that such and such a girl had bought I don't know what in his store... at Troina.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Is that far from here?

lines.speaker: u3548
lines.text: About fifty miles or so. If you want, I'll give you the name of the storekeeper.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Yes... of course... But you should also print that in your paper... But right away, tomorrow morning... It's the local Palermo paper, isn't it?... I mean, it's widely read...

lines.speaker: u3548
lines.text: Yes, but why do you think our readers would be interested in such news now? Even if I sent it, the editors wouldn't print it.

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: You really must do me this one favor.

lines.speaker: u3548
lines.text: Pardon me, but why must I do you a favor?

lines.speaker: u3545
lines.text: Then let's call it a business proposition. Something to round out your salary.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: What did you do?

lines.speaker: u3549
lines.text: I put her to sleep.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: H... how?

lines.speaker: u3549
lines.text: I tied the cord around her neck... wrapped her in the bloody sheets... and stuffed her in the trash can.

lines.speaker: u3550
lines.text: I've been watching. We were fine 'till she came. She brought the devil here.  There was blood on her hand that night.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Agnes?  Who?  Mother Superior?

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u3550
lines.text: Look into the convent records.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Sister...

lines.speaker: u3551
lines.text: Martha, you have to make a decision on her sanity as quickly as possible and not interfere with due process of law.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: No... no, excuse me Eve. As quickly as I see fit.

lines.speaker: u3551
lines.text: The longer you take to make a decision, the more difficult it will be for us.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u3551
lines.text: The bishop is breathing down our necks.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: And the sooner she goes to prison, the better off she'll be?

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u3552
lines.text: If I find anything I'll call you.

lines.speaker: u3553
lines.text: No, no, no...

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: I can get you new evidence next week.

lines.speaker: u3553
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Tomorrow... tomorrow, I'll get it by tomorrow. I will.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Hello, Mama  ... brought you something.

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: Shut up, I'm trying to watch this.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: It's your favourite...

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: It's Martha, Mama.  There you go.

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: Marie brings me icecream too you know. Chocolate... my favourite.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: I thought cherry-vanilla was your favourite.

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: Not any more... now I like chocolate.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Did you have a good week Mama. Are they treating you all right?

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: You know Martha never comes to see me. You watch it, she's going straight to hell... after all the things she said to me. Then she marries that son of a bitch of a Frenchman... has an abortion. I knew that one wouldn't work out. Not like you Marie. You got married to God.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Marie's dead Mama.

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: I remember when you was a little girl Marie. You come back from the movies and you'd say - Mama that ending was so sad... and I'd tell you they had all the happy endings locked away in a vault in Hollywood.  And you believed me.

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Mama, that wasn't Marie, that was me!

lines.speaker: u3554
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: I... I'm Martha, Mama.

lines.speaker: u3557
lines.text: Oh, don't do this!

lines.speaker: u3555
lines.text: Wasn't it!

lines.speaker: u3559
lines.text: Of course, John.

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: Yes, they were playing the queues outside the picture palaces of Liverpool. Scruffy young lads, lacking even the price of a jam roll. Orphans, every Paddy's son of 'em. I saw their potential at once although I had me doubts about the little fella, a savage primitive, that Ringo, but it was him what gave in first. He picked up a brick and heaved it at me and I quelled him wid one fierce flash of me eyes. "Mister, can you spare us a copper?" he said. I was disarmed by the grubby little outstretched mauler ... So, I took them under me managerial banner.

lines.speaker: u3559
lines.text: The usual ten per cent?

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: Oh, not at all, I let them have twenty-five; sure aren't there four of them?

lines.speaker: u3559
lines.text: How fascinating. Do go on ...  ... John.

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: ... Oh, I'm all heart, Ma'am, all heart ... Well, I let ...

lines.speaker: u3560
lines.text: They're yours.

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: They are?

lines.speaker: u3560
lines.text: The cards... you're bank.

lines.speaker: u3561
lines.text: Why aren't you at work?

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: I'm a deserter, too.

lines.speaker: u3561
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: The police have the poor unfortunate lad in the Bridewell.

lines.speaker: u3562
lines.text: The police station.

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: He'll be pulp by now.

lines.speaker: u3563
lines.text: Boys, you don't know what this means to me. If you hadn't come back it would have been the epilogue or the news in Welsh for life.

lines.speaker: u3571
lines.text: Aren't you supposed to be in that box?

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: Leave them drums alone.

lines.speaker: u3564
lines.text: Oh, surely one can have a tiny touch.

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: If you so much as breathe heavy on them, I'm out on strike.

lines.speaker: u3564
lines.text: Aren't you being rather arbitrary?

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: That's right retreat behind a smoke screen of bourgeois cliches. I don't go round messing about with your ear-phones, do I?

lines.speaker: u3564
lines.text: Spoil sport!

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: Well!

lines.speaker: u3565
lines.text: We're nearly there, sir.

lines.speaker: u3569
lines.text: Eh ... don't call him sir, he's got enough delusions of power as it is.

lines.speaker: u3566
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.speaker: u3577
lines.text: Eh, there's only three of them.

lines.speaker: u3567
lines.text: Well, it's nice to know you think we're clever.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: And cunning.

lines.speaker: u3567
lines.text: And what do you do about it?

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: Me? Oh, I don't have the time, I'm always running about with the lads ... no, we don't have the time.

lines.speaker: u3567
lines.text: Pity.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: Aye, it is but as long as you get by, it's all right, you know ... bash on, happy valley's when they let you stop. Anyroad, I'd better get back.

lines.speaker: u3567
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: See you.

lines.speaker: u3567
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: And another thing, where's that old mixer?

lines.speaker: u3568
lines.text: Here, Pauly.

lines.speaker: u3574
lines.text: Well!

lines.speaker: u3569
lines.text: He'll get over it.

lines.speaker: u3577
lines.text: ... as they head up for the show. Oh yes, well I mean it'ud be a pity to miss the show, wouldn't it like.

lines.speaker: u3571
lines.text: Shurrup, cheerful.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: Shove the gentleman jockey in the make-up room or something and keep your eye on him, will you?

lines.speaker: u3577
lines.text: I'm an electrician, not a wet nurse, y'know.

lines.speaker: u3572
lines.text: I'll set John on you!

lines.speaker: u3577
lines.text: Oh, anything you say, Paul.

lines.speaker: u3576
lines.text: So you just brought the old chap out of the crowd for his own good.

lines.speaker: u3573
lines.text: Yeah, but he insisted on us bringing him to the station.

lines.speaker: u3576
lines.text: Well, he can't stop here.

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: Breathe deeply.

lines.speaker: u3579
lines.text: <u>OH GOD IT HURTS SO BAD</u>!

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: Computer!  I've turned all the cooling units back on!  What's wrong?

lines.speaker: u3580
lines.text: The reaction has proceeded too far. The core has begun to melt.  Engines will overload in 2 minutes, 35 seconds.

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: All right... but do <u>not</u> go below decks.

lines.speaker: u3581
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: And be right back.

lines.speaker: u3582
lines.text: Just keep your finger off the button till she's way away from the ship, that's all.

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: Is it armed?

lines.speaker: u3582
lines.text: If you press the button right now, it will blow the whole nose of the ship off.

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: Thanks for the thought.

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: First thing I'm going to do when we get back is eat some biological food.

lines.speaker: u3583
lines.text: What's the matter, you don't like this stuff?

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: Tastes like something you'd feed a chicken to make it lay more eggs.

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: That was Melkonis... it ate Hunter...

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: I'll get you out of there.

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: No... don't...

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: But I can save you -- get you to the Autodoc!

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: No good... it's eaten too much of me...

lines.speaker: u3584
lines.text: What can I do?

lines.speaker: u3585
lines.text: Kill me...

lines.speaker: u3598
lines.text: Let's get back and call this in.

lines.speaker: u3586
lines.text: Wait a minute.

lines.speaker: u3587
lines.text: Minh...

lines.speaker: u3595
lines.text: Yep...

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: If I can get to the chopper, I'll meet you at the rendezvous.  Don't wait for me.

lines.speaker: u3588
lines.text: But...

lines.speaker: u3592
lines.text: Move it baby, or they're gonna be chewin' on my cojones!

lines.speaker: u3589
lines.text: Couple more seconds!

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: Nobody wander off on their own until it's found.  Keep in pairs. Diller, once the first team's done their sweep I want you to go down with Annie to Three-Pump while she replaces it.

lines.speaker: u3590
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: One final point.  Killing this sonuvabitch ought to be a reward in itself.  However, just to add a little incentive... I'm authorizing a hefty bonus in the next pay-packet for whoever does.

lines.speaker: u3591
lines.text: We had to.  They were just too cumbersome for some of the conduits you're gonna have to negotiate.  Besides, all the crap floating around reduces visibility to the extent where I doubt having helmet lights would have make that much difference, anyway.  Maintenance lights down there oughta be enough to do the trick.

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: How tight are these shafts?

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: And...?

lines.speaker: u3592
lines.text: And, nothing.  They checked out just fine.

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: They...they snapped my legs to fit... fit me in here.  I don't...remember what happened next.

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: What can I do?

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: I can... feel it moving around inside me. You've got to kill me.

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: I... I can't!

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: You have to...

lines.speaker: u3593
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u3596
lines.text: Today's party's finished their sweep, the relief team's out there now. Everybody else is either asleep or running shift in the auto-shop.

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: You should hit the sack, too.

lines.speaker: u3596
lines.text: Nah, I'll stick it out for another hour or so.

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: What time's sundown?

lines.speaker: u3596
lines.text: 'Bout five minutes.

lines.speaker: u3594
lines.text: Give me a yell is something happens.

lines.speaker: u3596
lines.text: You got it, cowboy.

lines.speaker: u3599
lines.text: Eve was incredibly modest. She insisted that no credit was due her, that Lloyd felt as he did only because she read lines exactly as he had written them.

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: The implication being that I have not been reading them as written.

lines.speaker: u3599
lines.text: To the best of my recollection, neither your name nor your performance entered the conversation.

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: Don't run away, Bill.

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: From what would I be running?

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: You're always after truth - on the stage. What about off?

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: I'm for it.

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: Then face it. I have. Since that first night - here - in the dressing room.

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: When I told you what every young actress should know.

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: When you told me that whatever I became, it would be because of you-

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: Your make-up's a little heavy.

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: - and for you.

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: You're quite a girl.

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: You think?

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: I'm in love with Margo. Hadn't you heard?

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: You hear all kinds of things.

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: I'm only human, rumors to the contrary. And I'm as curious as the next man...

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: Find out.

lines.speaker: u3600
lines.text: Only thing, what I go after, I want to go after. I don't want it to come after me.

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: You all put together?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: My back's open.  Did the extra help get here?

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: There's some loose characters dressed like maids and butlers. Who'd you call - the William Morris Agency?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: You're not being funny, I could get actors for less. What about the food?

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: The caterer had to back for hors d'oeuvres-  Voila.

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: That French ventriloquist taught you a lot, didn't he?

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: There was nothing he didn't know.  There's a message from the bartender. Does Miss Channing know we ordered domestic gin by mistake?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: The only thing I ordered by mistake is the guests.  They're domestic, too, and they don't care what they drink as long as it burns... where's Bill? He's late.

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: Late for what?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Don't be dense. The party.

lines.speaker: u3601
lines.text: I ain't dense. And he's been here twenty minutes.

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Well, I certainly think it's odd he hasn't even come up...

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: Miss Channing, I can't tell you how glad I am that you arrived so late.

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Really, Eve? Why?

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: Well, if you'd been here to begin with, I wouldn't have dared to read at all...

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u3602
lines.text: ... and if you'd come in the middle, I'd have stopped, I couldn't have gone on-

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: What a pity, all that fire and music being turned off...

lines.speaker: u3604
lines.text: Have you forgotten about Eve? What she is, what she's done?

lines.speaker: u3605
lines.text: Old wives' tales, born of envy and jealousy! And a phobia against truth!

lines.speaker: u3604
lines.text: Then tell me this isn't true! That your concern for your play and career is one thing - and that poor frightened hysterical girl another - and that your concern for her has nothing to do with either your play or your career!

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Now wait a minute, you're always so touchy about his plays, it isn't the part - it's a great part. And a fine play. But not for me anymore - not a foursquare, upright, downright, forthright married lady.

lines.speaker: u3605
lines.text: What's your being married got to do with it?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: It means I've finally got a life to live! I don't have to play parts I'm too old for - just because I've got nothing to do with my nights!  I know you've made plans. I'll make it up to you, believe me. I'll tour a year with this one, anything - only you do understand - don't you, Lloyd?

lines.speaker: u3607
lines.text: This is for lawyers to talk about, this concerns a run-of-the-play contract, and this you can't rewrite or ad lib!

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Are you threatening me with legal action, Mr. Fabian?

lines.speaker: u3607
lines.text: Are you breaking the contract?

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Answer my question!

lines.speaker: u3607
lines.text: Who am I to threaten? I'm a dying man.

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: I didn't hear you.

lines.speaker: u3607
lines.text: I said I'm a dying man!

lines.speaker: u3606
lines.text: Not until the last drugstore has sold its last pill!

lines.speaker: u3611
lines.text: --if we wrote a story that said Haldeman controlled the fund?--

lines.speaker: u3633
lines.text: --let me put it this way: I'd have no problem if you did.

lines.speaker: u3613
lines.text: Anything else from Mr. Throat?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Mitchell started the cover-up early, everyone is involved in the cover- up, all the way to the top. The whole U.S. intelligence community is mixed in with the covert activities. The extent of it is incredible.  And people's lives are in danger, maybe including ours.

lines.speaker: u3614
lines.text: They are not my clients.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: You're a lawyer and you're here--

lines.speaker: u3614
lines.text: --I met one of the defendants, Mr. Barker, at a social occasion once--  --I have nothing more to say.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: A Miami social occasion?  Mr. Rafferty told me the Cubans were from Miami.

lines.speaker: u3614
lines.text: Barker's wife called me at three this morning; her husband apparently had told her to call if he hadn't called her by then.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: It was really nice of you to come, since you'd only met him once.

lines.speaker: u3614
lines.text: Are you implying you don't believe me?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: I have nothing more to say.

lines.speaker: u3614
lines.text: You don't mind getting on people's nerves, do you?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: You claiming it was all a misunderstanding, Ken?

lines.speaker: u3615
lines.text: Absolutely--Marilyn's gotten it totally wrong--

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: She's an awfully good reporter--I can't remember her getting too much wrong before, can you?

lines.speaker: u3615
lines.text: That's a bullshit question, that's a question straight out of Wichita, Kansas.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Sorry, Ken; listen, one last thing: where did your talk with Berger happen?

lines.speaker: u3615
lines.text: Where?  What do you mean, where?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Well, was it in a bar, her apartment, some restaurant--

lines.speaker: u3615
lines.text: --I've completely forgotten where it was, except I know it wasn't her apartment.

lines.speaker: u3616
lines.text: That twenty-five thousand dollars is money I collected for Nixon in this year's campaign.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: I see. And how do you think it reached Miami?

lines.speaker: u3616
lines.text: I don't know; I really don't. The last time I saw it was when I was in Washington. I gave it to the Finance department of the Committee to Re- Elect the President. How it got to that burglar, your guess is as good as mine.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: That checks out with our finding, thank you, Mr. Dahlberg.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: --I know, I know, the pressure's off the White House and it's all back on the Post--

lines.speaker: u3618
lines.text: --you've done worse than let Haldeman slip away, you've got people feeling sorry for him--I didn't think that was possible. A conspiracy like this-- the rope has to tighten slowly around everyone's neck. You build from the outer edges and you go step by step. If you shoot too high and miss, then everybody feels more secure. You've put the investigation back months.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: We know that--and if we were wrong, we're resigning--were we wrong?

lines.speaker: u3618
lines.text: You'll have to find that out, won't you?--

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Hello, I'm Bob Woodward of the Washing Post and...  Mullen and Company Public Relations? Could you tell me when you expect Mr. Hunt?  He is?

lines.speaker: u3621
lines.text: Howard Hunt here.

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Hi, I'm Bob Woodward of the Post and--

lines.speaker: u3621
lines.text: --yes, yes, what is it?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: I was just kind of wondering why your name and phone number were in the address books of two of the men arrested at Watergate?

lines.speaker: u3621
lines.text: Good God!

lines.speaker: u3624
lines.text: And what is your occupation, Mr. McCord?

lines.speaker: u3625
lines.text: Security consultant.

lines.speaker: u3624
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u3625
lines.text: Government. Recently retired.

lines.speaker: u3624
lines.text: Where in government?

lines.speaker: u3625
lines.text: ...Central... Intelligence... Agency...

lines.speaker: u3624
lines.text: Where?

lines.speaker: u3625
lines.text: The C.I.A.

lines.speaker: u3627
lines.text: We're going to need lots of good luck, aren't we?

lines.speaker: u3635
lines.text: Nobody ever had too much.

lines.speaker: u3629
lines.text: --correction--when you were drinking your lunch at the bar of the Sans Souci--

lines.speaker: u3628
lines.text: --this White House guy, a good one, a pro, came up and asked what is this Watergate compulsion with you guys and I said, well, we think it's important and he said, if it's so goddamn important, who the hell are Woodward and Bernstein?

lines.speaker: u3629
lines.text: Ask him what he's really saying--he means take the story away from Woodstein and give it to his people at the National Desk--

lines.speaker: u3628
lines.text: --well, I've got some pretty experienced fellas sitting around, wouldn't you say so?--

lines.speaker: u3629
lines.text: --absolutely--and that's all they do, sit sit sit--every once in a while, they call up a Senator, some reporting--

lines.speaker: u3628
lines.text: --well, what if your boys get it wrong--

lines.speaker: u3632
lines.text: More denunciations?

lines.speaker: u3629
lines.text: One Senator just gave a speech slurring us 57 times in 20 minutes.
